loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
61-year-old Roberto L. is a hardworking fisherman. Despite losing his wife, he continues to go on with his life. He has four children to take care of. He dreams of his fishing business prospering so that he will be able to help improve his family’s living conditions.

Roberto is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used to buy fishnets and other fishing tackle. This loan will truly help Roberto achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and other fishing tackle.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides sells fish to earn a living. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. She owns a fishing boat that her husband uses to catch fish. She dreams of succeeding in her ventures so she can also sustain her children’s education. One of her goals is to have all her children finish college. She says that it won't be easy but by God’s grace, she and her husband will achieve their dreams and goals. 

Leonides is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 and intends to use this loan to buy fishnets and other fishing materials.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris resides in Albur, Bohol with her family. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She sells fish for a living. Her husband goes out to the sea to catch fish and she sells all his catch at the market. Sometimes, she walks around her home to sell fish. She prays that God will continue to strengthen her and her husband so that they will be able to provide for their family’s needs.

Iris is a new member of CEVI. She said that she joined because of its low interest rate. She applied for a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to buy fishnets and other fishing materials.

loans.use: To purchase fishnets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
In Kam Nab village in Kandal province these four people make up a group loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokha S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She owns a general store in the local village and, since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, in order to improve her family living conditions, she decided to request a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

Mrs. Sokha S.’s husband, Mr. Keov Toem, owns a rice mill in the local village. Through this activity, the couple supports six children, one of whom is a motorbike repairer, another is a car repairer, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Yorn Yem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has thirteen people who all live in Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yorn Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller who is able to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

Mrs. Yorn Y. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de oro. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. Meraluna makes a living raising livestock. The main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Meraluna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Meraluna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her lifestyle and her ability to engage in business activities. Meraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Meraluna is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Meraluna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 6 and 3, in Harhorin province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for five years. Her husband, Bathuu, is 32 years old and a herder. 

Currently, Tsevelmaa operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Manlai Tod. She has been operating her business since 2005, and has steadily expanded her business. She started renting an extra counter in 2009. Her business profit is high during the summer months, from June to September, but is low from March to May. Tsevelmaa has good communication skills and she is focused on the future. She is requesting a 3,200,000 tugrug (~ 2,251 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Mreah Prov village in TaK. Province, these ten people make up a village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sao M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Koev, is a motorbike taxi driver.

Even though they have different careers, they earn less income than needed, so they want to start a new business but do not have enough money to support it. Therefore, Mrs. Sao M. decided to apply for a loan to purchase some piglets to raise.

Mrs. Sao M. is the mother of five children, two of whom are jewelers, another is a tailor, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To purchase some piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mrs. Flora P. manages a sari-sari store located at her house in Loon, Bohol. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide her family food to eat, clothes to wear, and a proper education for her children. 

She was a member of CEVI years ago but due to the challenges she faced, she had to withdraw her membership. She recently returned to gain access to its programs. She is applying for a loan of Php 6,000, which she will use to acquire inventory for her store such as sugar, oil, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: "One of my dreams in life is to give my children proper education,” shares 58-year-old Carolina. She is married and has three children. She says that her children’s education is one of the challenges she and her husband currently face because school fees keep increasing every year. She keeps working hard to achieve her goals. She raises hogs to earn a living. She sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines, for financial support for her business. She applied for a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos, which she will use to buy additional piglets and also feed for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Berdimurat, is 32 years old and a driver for a company called Erchim. Currently, Aliya operates a beauty products trading business with her husband's help at a local market called Tirlik. Aliya has been operating her business since 2000 and she has expanded her business and her product line. With a lot of hard work and determination, her total working capital exceeds 1,200,000 tugrugs (~ 845 USD). She has a loyal customer base because of her good service and communication skills. Her monthly net profit is between 300,000 – 500,000 tugrugs (~ 210 – 350 USD).  Since she started her business, her family's quality of live has improved.  Aliya is an enthusiastic person who has many plans for the future. She says, “I would like to purchase my own car, which will save in transportation costs.”  She is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to contribute money to purchase a car for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Like other mothers, Maribeth only wants the best for her children. She dreams of having her three children finish college and find decent jobs for themselves. She works hard to achieve her goals. She runs a sari-sari store situated at her house. She hopes to grow her store and earn a better income. She also makes tocino, a marinated pork delicacy and very popular in the Philippines. She mostly sells them to her regular customers.

Maribeth applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. She will use it to buy additional merchandise and she will also buy pork meat to make tocino.

loans.use: Additional inventory and meat for making tocino

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en: Nemesia was fond of making dresses and other clothes even when she was younger. Now that she is 58, married and has three children, she uses her skills to earn a living. She set up a space at her house that serves as her tailoring shop. She hopes to improve her space so she can work better. She applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will be used to buying cloth, thread and other materials she needs for tailoring.

loans.use: To buy cloth and tailoring materials

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Batnasan is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment, which they own. In addition to their apartment, they own a plot of land with a house. Currently, Batnasan operates a transportation business in his town. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Batnasan has been operating his business since 2000 and he started his business with one car. His business has grown quickly over the years and he purchased another car in 2005. Batnasan has expanded his business and become a very experienced driver. His earnings have enabled him to buy the apartment for his family and his family's quality of life is good. For the future, Batnasan plans to buy a microbus and further expand his business.  He is requesting a 3,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase this microbus for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a microbus

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes sells tuba, which is a coconut wine. It is famous not just in Praxedes’ town, but all over the Philippines. Having three children with her husband Ramo, she works hard to help provide for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education. She dreams of having them graduate from college in the near future. 

Praxedes applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use it to increase her stock of tuba and containers.

loans.use: To purchase tuba and containers

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mr. Pheap B. is 48 years old and is a villager who lives in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sarom Khloak, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate vegetables to earn a living for their family. His wife is on the left in the photo.

In order to support their farm crops, Mr. Pheap B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mr. Pheap B. is the father of three children: one is a teacher in the local school, another is a farmer who supports the parents’ farming while the last one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Boldbaatar, is 44 years old and is a carpenter. Her oldest son, Purevsuren, is 18 years old and attends university. Her youngest child, Munhnaran, is eight years old and attends a local secondary school. During the day, Bolormaa operates a vegetable trading business at a local market called Shine-Altai. She started her business in 1999 with working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2111 USD) today. Her earnings enabled her to purchase her own plot of land with a house in Darhan city and to pay university tuition fees for her oldest child. Bolormaa has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I have been planning to build a warehouse for my business in the future. In addition, I would like to provide a good education for my two children.”  She is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of vegetables, including potatoes and onions, to sell to her many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Chhuorn's Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people, who are all living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. The members will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Chhuorn R. is 57 years old and he is the village bank president who has selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Koet, are pig breeders and also rice-wine makers who are able to earn a small income to support their family.

Since their pig business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mr. Chhuorn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and sell. With this loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his family living conditions. This couple has a child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en: Bolortuya is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment, which they own. Her two children, ages five and three, attend a local kindergarten. During the day, Bolortuya operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Norjin. She sells a variety of women's clothing to her many customers. She started her business in 2006. Her business has grown quickly over the years and she has gained much experience as a businesswoman.  Today, her working capital exceeds 3,500,000 tugrugs (~2465 USD) and her daily revenue is between 50,000 – 70,000 tugrugs (~35–50 USD). Furthermore, Bolortuya's business profit is 40% and she has been planning to expand her business. She also built a garage for 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1407 USD) and rents it to car owners for a profit. Bolortuya is a very hard working person and the most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. She would like to be financially secure for her children in the future. She is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more clothing from China to sell at her local market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Thy M. is a 30-year-old married man and he is the leader of this group loan which consists of four-members located in Preaek Ksev village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Thy M. is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. For this business, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for his business.

Mr. Thy M.’ wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Run, is a farming laborer who receives a small salary to support her family. This couple has three children: one is a student in the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his business

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mr. Noem M. has been engaged in the animal sale trade since 2006. He buys cows at reasonable cost from the rural citizens and fattens them for a while before selling them to farmers or slaughterers. By doing this, he is able to receive $5 a day to serve his family’s daily food needs. Noem M.'s wife  sews clothes in industry, and they help each other to earn money in order to feed their two children who are enrolled in school. Noem M. has a problem with transportation. He travels to buy cows by hiring a taxi. He hopes to eliminate this expense and is requesting a loan of $1200 to be used to purchase a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle..

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ny N. is the  leader for this group loan, which  consists of 4 members located in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items of support for different purposes. 
Mr. Ny N. and his wife, Mrs. Phoeun Eath, are farmers who own 5-hectare field where they cultivate rice to earn a living. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the farm crops. Thus, Mr. Ny N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support his farming. This couple has five children; two are farmers who help support their parents' farming while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en: Chinbat is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house that they own. They have been living together in their current home for 13 years. Currently, Chinbat operates a juniper trading business with his wife. Juniper is an important part of spiritual cleansing in Buddhism. He has been operating his business since 1998 and has steadily expanded his business since that time. He has also built a good reputation among his customers. His business is very popular and his customer base includes both residents of his province as well as other provinces. Presently, he made a contract to supply juniper to a new monastery that recently opened in the Selenge province. He has been planning to build his own workplace on his own plot of land. Chinbat is a very energetic person and says, “I am working hard to build a bright future for my family.” He is requesting a 3,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase necessary equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Dashtsermaa

texts.en: Dashtsermaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband and three-year-old child in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment that they own. They have been living together in their current home for five years. During the day, Dashtsermaa operates a clothing trading business in her town. She sells a variety of clothing with her husband at a local trading center called Altan eh (Golden mother). Dashtsermaa has been operating her business since 2003. She has steadily expanded her business and gained much experience in previous years. At the beginning, she sold her products at her home, but since 2004 she started renting a counter at Altan-eh. Dashtsermaa is a very hardworking person and her business is very important for her. She says, “I would like to expand my business and improve my family's quality of life.” She is requesting a 1,600,000-tugrug loan to purchase more clothing from Ereen, a Chinese border town, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
This group loan involves ten people, who all  live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.  Mr. Yong S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. 
Mr. Yong S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables and rice to earn a living for his family. Mr. Yong S. is asking  for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support his farming. His wife, Mrs. Pov S., is staying at home to take care of their children. This couple has three children, one is a student in the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
The group consists of 14 members located in Prey Toteung village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mach N. is 39 years old and she is the village bank president who has selected by the members.  The members will use the loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Mach N. and her husband, Mr. Run Khon, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice for a living. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the farm crops. Thus, Mrs. Mach N. is asking  for a loan to purchase a motor for a water pump. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory while two others are students in the local school and also work on their parents' farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for a water pump

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rental yard. They have been living together in their current home for four years. His wife, Saihantuya, is 39 years old and operates a movie rental business.

Currently, Erdenebat operates a taxi service in his town. He has been operating his business since 2004, and has gained much experience during these years. He is a very hard working person and he says, “I would like to expand my business and to improve the quality of my family's life.” He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (~1407 USD) to purchase spare parts for his car for his taxi service and more DVDs for his wife's movie rental business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi and DVDs for a movie rental business

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng S. is a 49-year  old married woman, who lives in  Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Her husband works as a construction foreman. They have three daughters who are employed and help to provide a little of their income to resolve the family’s financial problems. Sreng is a good housewife who takes care of the children and cooks tasty foods for the family.  She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for her husband to use to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bov

texts.en: Mr. Bov B., 70, and his wife, Mrs. Peom Rous, 60, are rice farmers. They have been farming for 31 years. With their experience, they earn approximately five dollars per day. The couple has nine children: one drives a taxi, earning $150 per month; others are married, working and have started new homes. In order to help their laborers in the farm work, Bov B. is applying for a loan of $500 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL. He will use the loan to buy a couple of water buffalo to plow his farmland. Bov B. was busy at his farming business activities when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a couple of water buffalo.

loans.name: Sandra Emerita

texts.es: Sandra Emerita M. P. 38 años de edad, reside en colonia el bambú, jurisdicción de Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a tres hijos, por los cuales ha trabajado muy duro por sacarlos adelante. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajador, la cual ha luchado mucho por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo tortillas, puesto el cual esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco, las tortillas son un alimento que los salvadoreños consumen diariamente, razón por la que es un negocio muy rentable, en el cual se puede generara muy buenas ganancias. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de masa para elaborar más tortillas, así mismo desea poder comprar varios cilindros de gas propano con el fin de poder contar con una reservar de estos, lo cual le permita ahorrar un poco de dinero. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Sandra ya que a través del crédito solicitado a Integral ella espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Emerita M. P. is 38 years old and resides in the subdivision of El Bambú, which is in the jurisdiction of Jiquilisco and located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her three children, for whom she works extremely hard so that they can get ahead. Sandra struggles to provide her children with everything they need. For several years she has been dedicated to making tortillas. Her vending post is located in the municipal market of Jiquilisco. Tortillas are a daily staple consumed by Salvadorans, which is why her business is very profitable and allows her to generate good earnings.

Sandra is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of cornmeal in order to make more tortillas. At the same time, she plans to buy a few cylinders of propane gas to have in reserve since this will save her a little money. Sandra is thrilled to be able to request a loan from Apoyo Integral and hopes to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cornmeal & propane

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es: Rosa Yanira G. D. B. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 16,12 y 9 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Rosa posee un negocio propio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos perecederos, los cuales son D. mucha necesidad en el hogar, ya sea para alimentación como para el mantenimiento del hogar. Este negocio es muy importante para Rosa, ya que es gracias a este que ella pueD. brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, en especial aquellos que son más vendido tales como pan, leche, huevos, embutidos y otros más, estos le permitirán mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, permitiéndole invertir aún más en el y D. esta manera mantenerlo estable.
texts.en:
Rosa Yanira G. D. B. is 37 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who is devoted to his work, and their three children (ages 16, 12, and 9) who are in school. Rosa manages her own business, a store where she sells perishable products that are of great necessity in the home and used for feeding one’s family.

This business is very important to Rosa because it allows her to help her husband with all of the household expenses. For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of products, especially those that she sells the most such as bread, milk, eggs, sausages, and other items. This will enable her to improve her sales and invest more into her business so that it remains stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of perishable products

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es: Rubén Z. H. de 48 años de edad, reside en San Marcos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad. Rubén posee una venta de verduras, la cual esta ubicada en la terminal del sur, lugar en el cual llegan los buses desde el occidente del país, lo cual lo hace un lugar muy apto para este tipo de comercio, así mismo Rubén se sube a los buses a ofrecer sus productos, los cuales los coloca dentro de una bolsa plástica, con una medida exacta, para ofrecerlos a los pasajeros del transporte público, mientras tanto su esposa se encarga de atender el negocio. Desde hace 6 años que él junto a su esposa se dedican a este tipo de trabajo, lo cual les ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para contar con una vida estable. Rubén solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, en gran variedad de estas, ya que a este lugar llegan diferentes tipos de personas con diversos gustos. Todo esto les permitirá crecer en su negocio y de esta manera tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rubén Z. H. is 48 years old and resides in San Marcos, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 11 and 12. Rubén has a vegetable stand located in the south terminal where all the buses arrive from the western part of the country. This place is suitable for this type of business since the vegetables he offers are shipped in by bus. He packages the vegetables into plastic bags and weighs them precisely before offering them to the bus passengers for sale. Meanwhile, his wife is in charge of attending to the customers. Rubén and his wife have been in this business for six years and it has permitted them to have everything necessary to live a stable life.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy a large quantity and variety of vegetables so that he can cater to different types of people with different tastes. This will allow him to grow in his business and achieve a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Dalia Yanira

texts.es: Dalia Yanira P. de 34 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive únicamente junto a sus hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar el pequeño en el kinder, y el mayor estudia primer ciclo de educación básica. Dalia es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera, por lo cual debe esforzarse mucho más por ellos. Dalia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, negocio que esta ubicado en su propia casa de habitación, lo cual es una gran ventaja para ella ya que le permite trabajar al mismo tiempo que cuida de sus hijos. El mayor deseo de Dalia es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que pueda mejorar la estabilidad de su familiar.
texts.en:
Dalia Yanira P. is 34, lives in Antiguo Cuscatlan, located in La Libertad. She lives with her three and seven year old children, the little one is in kindergartner and the older one in elementary school. Dalia is a hardworking woman, who has put a lot of effort in taking care of her children, she is a single mom and thus has to work harder for them. Dalia owns a store in which she sells groceries and basic need products, the business is located in her house, which is an advantage for her as she can work and take car of her kids at the same time. Her wish is to improve sales, since they are her only source of income; that's why she requests a loan to Integral, through which she can buy more products and provide stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need products

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Mario Enrique M. C. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y cinco años de edad los cuales son estudiantes. Mario posee un negocio en el cual comercializa suplementos deportivos como uniformes, balones, y otros más. Desde hace 7 años que el negocio esta ubicado en este lugar, contando con muchos clientes como estudiantes de colegios y equipos que juegan en el lugar, lo cual le permite mantener estable su negocio. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar su mercadería comprando accesorios como calcetas, rodilleras, protectores,  guantes, balones y otros productos más los cuales son muy necesarios para las personas que practican deportes.
texts.en:
Mario Enrique M. C. is 33, lives in Sonsonate with his family comprised by his wife who is a homemaker and their two children ages nine and five who are students. Mario has a business where he commercializes sport items such as jerseys, balls and others. He's had the business at its current location for seven years, having many clients such as college students and sport teams which allows him to maintain a stable business. He requests a loan through which he can increase merchandise buying accessories such as socks, knee pads, protectors, gloves, balls and other products that are necessary for the people that play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sport items

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
Mansura A. was born in 1948. She is married, has a child and lives with her family in the Absheron region. She sews stylish feminine clothes on a machine and has been in this business for 15 years.

Mansura A. creates new fashionable feminine clothes. She likes to be innovative in her business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two electric sewing machines and cloth.

loans.use: To buy two electric sewing machines and cloth

loans.name: Debbie Lizzette

texts.es: Debbie Lizzette S. D.
texts.en:
29-year old Debbie Lizzette S. D. Ardón lives in San Antonio del Monte which is located in Sonsonate Department. She lives with her 4-year old and 6-year old children who are students in the local school. Her husband lives in the United States and sends money back to her. In spite of this, Debbie is an enterprising young woman who desires to get ahead and be able to have a better life both for her own and her children's sake. She has run a stall selling men's clothing for seven years. Debbie is asking for a loan so that she can buy more men's clothing and in this way increase sales even more. Despite her age, she is a hardworking person who gets good references from her neighbours and friends since she is well-known for being responsible and looking out for the wellbeing of her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

location.town: San Antonio del Monte, departamento de Sonsonate

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa L.
texts.en: Ana Rosa L.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make pupusas and tortillas.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es: Blanca Isabel G. D. C. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Blanca posee un comedor, en el cual se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo diferentes tipos D. bebidas naturales D. frutas, D. esta misma forma ella posee una tienda en la cual se encarga D. comercializar productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa D. 5 D. la mañana a 9 D. la noche. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su hogar, por lo cual se esfuerza día con día por salir adelante. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda invertir en ambos negocios pero sobre todo en la tienda ya que es la más reciente en haberse abierto a las personas y en la que más necesita invertir. Blanca desea mucho mejorar sus negocio y D. esta forma brindarle siempre esa ayuda tan necesaria para su esposo y D. esta manera solventar todos los gastos D. hogar.
texts.en:
50-year old Blanca Isabel G. D. C. lives in Sonsonate Department with her husband who works for a private business. They have two children who are students. Blanca runs a food stall where she makes breakfast and lunches as well as different types of natural fruit juices. She also has a store selling perishable items and everyday basics. She works from 5 in the morning to 9 at night. She does all this in order to improve the family's financial stablity and works hard every day to get ahead. For this reason Blanca is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Integral to invest in both businesses but most of all in the store since it was opened most recently and needs more money spent on it. She would really like to improve her businesses and in this way proviD. her husband with much needed help with all the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy everyday items for the store

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina S. D. R. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a una hija D. 22 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a trabajar, así mismo vive junto a un nieto. María se dedica a la venta D. huevos por mayor, contando con muchos clientes fijos, los cuales a diario compran su producto, razón por la que María lo considera como un negocio muy rentable el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para sostener su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. huevos, los cuales son muy bien vendidos en el lugar, ya que donD. María habita es una D. las ciudades más comerciales del departamento D. San Salvador, siendo apto par casi todo tipo D. negocio. María desea poder mejorar la estabilidad D. su negocio y D. esta manera la estabilidad D. su casa.
texts.en:
María Cristina S. D. R. is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 22 year old daughter, who is employed, and a grandson. María sells eggs in bulk and has many loyal customers who buy eggs from her on a daily basis. Because of this, Maria considers it to be a very profitable business that provides her with all the money she needs to maintain her home. Maria is applying for a loan with Intergral to purchase larger quantities of eggs which sell very well in her city, one of the most commercially active in the San Salvador department and suitable for almost any type of business. María hopes to improve the stability of her business and in doing so, the stability of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs in bulk

loans.name: Nilushika

texts.en:
Nilushika is a 28-year-old married woman living with her husband, mother and baby in Kekanadura area, Matara.

Nilushika operates a business with her husband selling herbal oil. She has asked for a loan of 20,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka for the development of her business. She wants to provide nutritious options for her family through the increased income that she hopes her business will generate.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To help finance the opening of a herbal-oil shop

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid A. is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Rashid and his family live in the Absheron region. Rashid has been selling agricultural produce near his home for four years. Now he is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN to buy agricultural produce, fruits and vegetables and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce, fruits and vegetables to improve his business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter G. N. is a 39 year old, hardworking single man. He has been running his own bakery for three years.  He bakes breads and cakes which he sells to the local residents.  Peter has one employee. His business is located in Uthiru, in the western part of the capital city, Nairobi.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter's business has really grown because he can access loans.  He hopes to continue to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future. Peter has requested a loan of kes 60,000 from to buy an electronic oven, renovate his premises and to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy an electronic oven, renovate the business premises and to buy more ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Renson

texts.en: Renson K. M. is 55 years old and has three children who go to school. He has been running a taxi business for four years.  Renson plans to buy another vehicle  to serve more customers.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Renson has been able to pay school fees for his children because he can access loans.  He has taken out three loans in the past from Faulu Kenya and he has successfully repaid them. Renson is determined to educate his children to university level. He has therefore requested a loan of kes 53,735 to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jhonie

texts.en: Jhonie owns a tricycle that he uses to transport people around his community. He is 37 years old, married with children. He said it is quite tiring driving the whole day but he does not mind as long as he knows he is earning for his family. He wants to prosper in what he does. He has applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP from CEVI, which he said he would use to renew his permit and buy tools for tricycle maintenance. This loan will really help Jhonie maintain his business.

loans.use: To renew his permit and buy tools for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long C. is 29 years old and lives in the  Dongkor District of Phnom Penh City where she works as a laborer in a garment factory. She has worked at this job since before she married. Long's husband sells a few items from home to earn a living. The family has two school-age children who are students. Long's family faces a problem with transportation expenses as they must always pay for taxis. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to ride to work or elsewhere. (Long was busy working in the factory when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. W. is a hardworking mother of three who has been selling used clothes as well as bed covers and cushions for three years. She also earns a living from farming. She works hard to provide for her family and also to educate her three children.

Hannah appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her grow her business and improve her living standard. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more used clothes for sale. Hannah hopes to open up more stalls for selling clothes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, a 47-year-old father of five, has been making furniture cushions for 14 years and also farms for extra income. Boniface is a hardworking man who strives to meet his family’s needs, including educating his five children.  A member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by accessing loans to expand his business.  Boniface now plans to buy a pickup truck for transporting his products to his clients and is therefore requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to top up his savings. He hopes to open up his own furniture company in the future and also dreams of buying a lorry for supplying his products in five years.

loans.use: To top up his savings to buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, her oldest a 17-year-old student. She dreams of her children finishing college and having a bright future. Leonila has a small sari-sari store at her house in Trinidad, Bohol and also dries fish that she sells at her store and sometimes in the market. She hopes to earn better to sustain her children’s education.  Leonila is now applying for a loan of Php 2,000 to purchase additional stocks for her store and also fresh fish that she can dry and sell.

loans.use: Additional store inventory

loans.name: Sudeepa Kumuduni

texts.en:
Sudeepa Kumuduni is a hardworking, 25-year-old married woman living with her husband and son in Kekanadura, Matara.

Sudeepa’s husband is a mechanic who has a vehicle garage on his own. Before he started this job, he looked after a poultry farm for five years. Now this farm is handled by Sudeepa.

Sudeepa has asked for a loan of 45,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka to improve the farm. In addition to this objective she hopes to help buy some equipment for her husband's garage.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for her poultry farm and equipment for her husband's garage

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is an older woman who lives in the rural area lof Phnom Penh. She was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has four children: one sews clothes in the garment industry and three are already married and live separately. She also has a brother who appears on the left in the picture above. He works in the construction field and provides a small income for the family.

Mrs. N. earns about $2 per day from cultivating a variety of crops on her land in the village. Because she wants to eliminate the expenses incurred in hiring taxis, she is seeking a loan of $1100 to purchase a new motorcycle to commute to work and elsewhere.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 48 years old and married with one child. She raises hogs and also runs a sari-sari store. She hopes her store and hog-raising business will grow more. She also prays for strength for her to continue providing for her family.

Manuela recently applied to CEVI for a loan of 12000 PHP. She will use it to add supplies to her store. She will also buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pigs.

loans.name: Mammadova

texts.en: V. Mammadova was born in 1972, is single and has a child. She lives with her child in the Absheron region. She sells only women's clothes and now she would like to sell clothes for men, women and children. She has been in this business for three years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy clothes for men, women and children to re-sell in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for men, women and children to re-sell

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a 43 year old married father of four, who are in school. He is a hardworking man who runs a furniture shop. He has been in this business for seven years and has two employees. Previously he sold mobile phone accessories and clothes before he ventured into this business.

He has been a member of Faulu Kenya and he plans to take out his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials for making furniture.

Jonah, a talented musician, hopes to produce his own gospel music in the future. He is also determined to educate his children to higher education levels.

loans.use: To buy materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Nilmini

texts.en:
Nilmini is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has two sons and two daughters who are still in school. Her husband is a businessman. They are very close and work well together.

Nilmini manages a bookbinding and photo-framing business which she started thirty years ago. She cooperates well with others, and has a lovely mood. She is very enthusiastic.

Nilmini has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her bookbinding and photo-framing business

loans.name: Hanatbek

texts.en:
Hanatbek is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. During the day, Hanatbek operates a taxi service business in his province. He has been operating his business since 2008 with his own car.

Recently, he purchased a Korean car in order to retire his old car. His daily revenue is between 20,000 and 25,000 tugrugs (~20 USD) and his net profit is 50%. Hanatbek is a hardworking person with a good personality. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to improve my car in order to provide more convenient services to my customers and to earn more profits.” He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~845 USD) loan for car repairs and to purchase new tires.

loans.use: For car repairs and to purchase new tires

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 38 years old and married with one child who goes to school. He has been selling second-hand clothes for 12 years to earn a living. He sells shirts and trousers and his customers are mostly men. He also sells used shoes. He has employed one person. He describes himself as hardworking and responsible.

Benson successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 KES which he used to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and diversify to a better business in the future.

He has requested a loan of 20000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy men’s shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.use: To add stock of shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of charcoal to increase her stock

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say P., 37, has earned her living as a sewing laborer in industry since she was single. With much experience she is able to earn a salary of over $100 per month to solve the living problems of her family.

Always, Say P. depends on the revenue that comes from her husband’s job as a building worker. This couple is blessed to have three school-aged kids, who are dependent on their cash. The current proceeds of Say P. and her husband are not enough to meet the entire family’s expenses.

Say P. wants to invest in a new business and she is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle with a connected trailer as equipment to sell sugar cane juice.

Say P., her husband, and their son are pictured, and they hope the loan will provide them with additional profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle with a trailer connected.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en: Vadim N. was born in 1966, is married and has three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and is now settled in the Absheron region. Vadim uses his car to transport agricultural produce. He has been in this business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Havinesh

texts.en:
Havinesh is 47 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Ihlas, is 38 years old and operates a transportation business. They have been living together in their current home for 20 years.

Currently, Havinesh operates a meat trading business at a local market called Tirlih. She has been operating her business since 2000, and it has steadily expanded. She started her business with working capital of 20,000 tugrugs (~15 USD). After years of successful operations, she has increased her working capital. Havinesh is an open-minded person and has many plans for the future. She says, “I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own house and shop in the future.” She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~705 USD) to purchase a large amount of meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Sam Oeun's Group

texts.en:
This 15-member loan group has selected Mrs. Sam Oeun C. as village bank president. The members are located in Prey Toteung village in Kandal province. The members will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Sam Oeun C. is a congee and boiled rice seller in the local market. She can earn a small income to support her family’s living. To support her business activities she decided to ask for a loan to purchase tables, an ice box, and pork and beef.

Her husband, Mr. Savoeun Mao, a police officer, receives a little salary to support his family. The couple has two children; one is a seamstress in the garment factory while the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase tables, ice box, pork and beef.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 32 year old single lady. She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been in this business for six months and has one employee. She treats her customers well and offers credit services to her best customers which keeps them returning.

She previously didn’t have a business premise until she decided to save enough money to put up a salon. She hopes to grow her business and open outlets in the future.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to improve her business by opening a massage parlor.

loans.use: To open up a massage parlor.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana S. was born in 1975. She lives in Ijevan city with her husband, two children, mother-in-law and father-in-law. Liana is a nurse, but she manages her own business: clothes and shoes trading. At the same time she and her family are busy with a swine breeding business.

With the profit from the business Liana’s family was able to construct their own shop, but it is still unrepaired, so Liana still manages her business in a rented shop in Ijevan Central fair.

Liana asks for a loan of 650000 AMD to buy a spring assortment of clothes and shoes to sell. She intends to spend future income to repair her own shop.

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Vy Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 10 people of this village bank loan, located in Kou Duol village in Takeo province, selected Mrs. S. Vy N. as a village bank president. Each member will use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. S. Vy N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice to support her family’s living. She also breeds pigs at her home. She has a problem because her pigs are too small to sell.

In order to improve her family’s living conditions Mrs. S. Vy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Houm, is a construction worker. Through these activities, the couple supports three children who attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a single mother of three. She has been operating a retail shop for six years. She is a young member of Faulu Kenya and has been trained on business management. This has helped her create a positive attitude toward business hence improving her business.

She has requested her first loan of 20000 KES from Faulu Kenya. She plans to use this loan to increase her stock of sugar, maize flour, baking flour, soaps and sodas.

She hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future. Miriam is determined to open up other business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To increase stock of sugar, maize flour, baking flour, soap and sodas.

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: Née en 1979, A. Hortense vit depuis sa naissance à Tchinvié, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Hortense est mariée à ADANOU Charles, un chauffeur, et est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Hortense vit avec sa famille à Tchinvié. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Hortense vend des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques à Porto-Novo. Hortense s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Hortense a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'élever un peu plus le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Hortense sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1979, Hortense A. has been living since her birth in Tchinvié, in the 2nd borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Charles ADANOU, a driver, and is the mother of two children, of whom one is still attending school. She lives with her family in Tchinvié, where the couple shares responsibility for family expenses. To meet her needs, Hortense sells clothes and beauty products in Porto-Novo. She gets her products from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and from the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Hortense has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. Wishing to raise the level of her activity and increase customer satisfaction, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Keut

texts.en: Mr. Keut N. is 41 years of age and currently works as a repairman in a motor company. Keut N. has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo. She earns a living by sewing clothes in industry.  The couple has three teenage children: one is no longer in school and is working in construction, and the remaining two are students.   Keut N. will be using his first loan to buy a couple of cows to raise for their offspring, which he can sell for extra income. The loan will provide the family with new assets.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows to raise

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 26 years old and married with a two year old child.  She runs a boutique at Rongata Rongai a few kilometers from the capital city Nairobi. With her income she assists her husband with the household expenses.   She has been in this business for one year and hopes to grow the business into a wholesaler in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy clothes for sale.  She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thary T. is a village bank president who has selected by 27 members and they all live in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.  Mrs. Thary T. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mrs. Thary T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sopheap TH., is a Cambodia rickshaw driver to earn a living. Mrs. Thary T. is 28 years old and a mother of two children. One of her children is a student in the local school and one is a vegetable seller who helps with the mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing produces toilet disinfectant and detergent. She does this in her house. She learned the skill from a church seminar and she decided to start her own production. Though she has been in the business for the past three years, she is faced with financial constraints that keep her from increasing her business and profitability. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more chemicals to produce more detergent and toilet disinfectant to sell.

She is married with six children. She is 50 years of age. Her husband is an automobile engineer and he supports his wife in the production process when there are no customers in his workshop. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more chemicals

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa owns a sari-sari store located at her house. She is only 20 and still single. Because of financial struggles, she was not able to go to college. Now that she has a store, she wants to take this opportunity to save for her college education. She also wants to help her parents provide for the increasing needs in their household. 

Risa joined CEVI to gain access to its program. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000, which she will use to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store like soap, soy sauce and many others.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao V. is a 60-year-old widow who earns her daily income by selling chop-wood that she buys in bulk from the forest people who bring it to sell directly at her house. She has four children who are already married. A couple of her children live with her and assist her in selling firewood and the others live independently. Mao V. is looking for assistance to buy a motorbike with a trailer connected. This will allow her to deliver chop-wood directly to the customer’s house. Note: Mrs. Mao V. was not available at that time so her daughter is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer connected.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir A. is 37 years old, married and has two children. He and his family live in the Absheron region. Zakir has been a plumbing specialist for 10 years. He goes into homes and repairs pipes, lays gas lines and lays water pipes. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials to improve his business

loans.name: Noélie Yémissi

texts.fr: A. Noélie Yémissi  est née le 24 Décembre 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  vit depuis 33 ans environs au quartier Lom-Nava à Cotonou. Mariée à AGOSSA, Noélie Yémissi  est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants de Noélie Yémissi , un n’est plus à sa charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Noélie Yémissi  vend des ustensiles de cuisine à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et au Ghana, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. Noélie Yémissi  exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans. C’est la première fois que Noélie Yémissi  sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Noélie Yémissi A. was born on December 24th, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noélie Yémissi has lived for almost 33 years in the area of Lom-Nava in Cotonou. Married to Agossi, Noélie Yémissi is the mother of three children, who are all attending school. One of the children is not under her responsability anymore. The couple provides for the various family expenses. To provide for that, Noélie Yémissi sells kitchen utensils in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Noélie Yémissi buys her supplies in Lome, Togo, and in Ghana, two neighboring states of Benin. Noélie Yémissi has been in this business for twenty years. This is the first time that Noélie Yémissi requests a loan from ALIDé in order to improve her business and better respond to the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana sells fish and crabs to earn a living. She is 34 years old and married with five children. Her eldest is 13 years old. She and her husband work very hard in order to provide for their needs. She also aims to sustain her children’s education until college. Her husband does his best to catch more fish and crabs and she makes sure to sell everything he catches from the sea. She said it is tiring at times but she is happy to have her husband by her side. 

Susana is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000. She will use it to buy fishnets and other fishing materials. This loan will truly help Susana achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of 24-members, is located in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocery seller who owns a grocery store to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Prach, operates a motorcycle and a trailer offering taxi services to earn for his family.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is 28 years old and the mother of three children: one is a student in the local school while the others are too young to stuD. or work.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia sells cooked food, pepper soup and drinks at her restaurant in Lagos to make a living and she has been in the business for a year now.

Olivia is a member of LAPO micro-finance and has a good record. She repays her loan as and when due without any delay. She wants to see her business grow and improve so she is requesting NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell.

Olivia is 38 years old and she has five children. She lives with her husband who is a businessman in Lagos. She appreciates all lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mr. Suos S., 60, is a hardworking and determined father who tries to earn money to feed his six children. All six of the children are learning in high school or universities. He has another small financial earner in his wife who sells porridge for breakfast time.

To pursue a daily income, Suos S. has equipment that he uses to provide a blacksmithing service and has some laborers to help operate his service. By doing this, he has ability to send his children to school and university.

Recently, one of Suos S.’s kids finished high school and needs to learn in a university but it requires a fee. Because of this, Suos S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to pay the university fee.

loans.use: To pay his child's university fee

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
35-year-old Tope is the mother of one kid. Her husband is a civil servant and they live together in Lagos.

Tope sells clothes, underwear and bras in her shop and she has been in this business for the past eight years. She is happy with the living standard of her family but hopes to improve upon it. She assists in taking care of the home with proceeds from her business.

Tope wants to expand her business in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes, underwear and bras to sell.

Tope is a member in LAPO micro-finance with a good repayment record and she promise to pay back her loan at the due dates. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, underwear and bras to sell

loans.name: Srey Sros' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Sros L. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She is the mother of four children: one is a student in the local school while the other three are too yoU. to study or work.

Mrs. Srey Sros L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members of this group which consists of eighteen-members. The members will use the loan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Srey Sros L. is a water seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sovandeth S., is on the staff of an organization and is able to earn a small salary to support his family, too.

In order to support her water business, Mrs. Srey Sros L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a hose for pumping water.

loans.use: To buy a hose for pumping water

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia hails from Ilogbo in Lagos State. She is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She is still strong and able to do more business so that she can improve on her family’s living standard.

Felicia sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks in her shop; she opens her shop every day of the week.

Felicia started her business six years ago and she is doing well. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO micro-finance for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar N. is a 30-year-old man.  He lives in the town of Ulaanbaatar.  He is married and has 2 very young children.  To make a living, Naranbaatar owns and operates a taxi.  Naranbaatar has been engaged in this business for over 4 years, and earns approximately 400,000 tugrug a month from it.

In 2010, Naranbaatar joined Credit Mongol to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He is now requesting a new loan of 500,000 tugrug.  The current loan will be used to finish building his house.

About Credit Mongol:
Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro and SME clients and to become the best performing company in micro and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Savoen's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people, who are all living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Savoen B. is the village bank president who has selected by the members. She sells clothes to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Lay Now, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to support her clothing business, Mrs. Savoen B. is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge her business. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en:
Sanubar H. was born in 1962. She  is a married woman with one child.  Sanubar and her family live in Absheron region.  Sanubar has had a bakery for 10 years. 

In this picture, you can see Sanubar creating the traditional national sweets for the "Novruz" holiday including "shekerbura" (sweet pastry filled with nuts and sugar) and "pakhlava" (baklava).  (Novruz is a feast of spring and the coming of the New Year).  These two sweets are special to Novruz and the rest of the year she bakes cakes and other sweets.  Sanubar is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy butter and other ingredients for baking cakes, shekerbura, pakhlava, "qogal" (a sweet roll), etc. in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy butter and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en:
Virgita is a single mother to a three year-old child. She is 44 and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She also makes "polvoron" (a common dessert made with powdered milk candy similar to shortbread) and fruit salad that she sells at Barangay’s Elementary School. She also plans to sells gasoline. She dreams for her child to finish college someday and have a bright future. 

She has applied for a loan of Php 6, 000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy store supplies like sugar, oil and other items. She will also buy ingredients for fruit salad and also gasoline so she can start selling it.

loans.use: To buy additional store inventory.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng R. is an old woman of fifty-two years who lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children, both of whom are married and live in the family home, working in the garment industry.

Since 1979, Leng R. has been cultivating various crops. Beside her farm work, she is skilled in producing cement jars. In order to earn additional profit, she requests a loan to purchase raw materials such as cement and other essential accessories that she uses to make jars for sale.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making cement jars

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang C. is the village bank president who was selected by the members of this group which consists of nineteen-members located I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose. With the loan, too, they hope to increase their income to improve their family living.

Mr. Samnang C. works I. security I. a private company and receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chreb Loem, is on the staff of an organization. I. order to travel to work, Mr. Samnang C. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

This couple has three children who are all students I. the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz A. is a young, 25 year-old, woman who is unmarried.  She lives in Absheron region with her family. You can see in the picture a very kind, friendly, hard-working teacher. Firangiz tutors students for their examinations and has had this business for three years. She is asking for a loan of of 2,000 AZN to buy a new computer to make her work easier. The computer would provide her with internet access to advance her students' educational level and help in administering tests for students.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Nalani

texts.en:
Nalani is a 23-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara. Her husband drives a three-wheeler taxi to earn income and help support the family.

Nalani operates a grocery store as her business. She is hardworking and receives help from her husband when he is not driving his taxi.

Nalani has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the improvement of her grocery store.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ran U. is 47 years old and she is the village bank president who has selected by the twenty-four members located I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. The members will each use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Ran U. is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Khon Cheok, raises and sells chickens. With these two businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family.

Mrs. Ran U. decided to ask for a loan to buy chicken feed to support her husband’s business and to buy more vegetables to enlarge her own business activities. With this loan, she hopes to increase their income to improve their family living.

This couple has four children: three are attending the local school while the youngest is only 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her husband's business and to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Soth O. is 44 years old and he has been selected by the ten members of his group as a village bank president.  They are located in Toul Krosang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for various purposes. For instance, Mr. Soth O. is barbecue and balut eggs seller who can earn a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Cheun MO., is a laborer who receives a small salary to help the family. 

In order to increase income to improve the family's living standards, Mr. Soth O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more beef and balut eggs to enlarge his business. Mr. Soth O. has five children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is staying at home, while the other two are students and also support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more beef and balut eggs

loans.name: Anusha

texts.en:
Anusha is 30-year-old married woman with two children: one son and one daughter. They are providing her with good help. She lives in Kekanadura, Matara in southern Sri Lanka.

Anusha has a business selling lunch packets consisting of rice and curry, and she has lots of experience in this type of business.

Anusha has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is a very active, honest and hardworking woman. She wants to increase the family income and hopes to do so with the improvement of her lunch-packet business.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for her business

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 43 years-old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for eight years. Her two children, Jambal and Shadav, attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Baasandorj, is 42 years-old and operates a small transportation business in the province.

During the day, Erdenechimeg, who is a professional decorator, runs a plasterwork service in her town. She has been operating her business for 10 years and she has built a stable operation. Recently, she received a contract with a local kindergarten for decorating the building. Erdenechimeg is a very open-minded person who has  good communication skills. She is requesting a 350,000 tugrug (~  275 USD) loan to repair her car which she uses for her business.

loans.use: To repair her car.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. He finished primary school. He will use this loan to develop and enlarge his shop. His family income will rise and he could get more constant clients to his shop. He is a good bread-winner and has to work hard to earn his living. He has a superb reputation in the market due to his age and also his fresh food and reasonable prices compared to his neighbors. This mini market is deemed as a major source to his earnings. He has been working in this business for a long time.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Suddacharige

texts.en:
Suddacharige is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons, 10 years and 3 years old. Her husband is a tire mechanic, so she manages her business herself.

Suddacharige has a tailoring business in her area, which she started three years ago. She cooperates well with others and is always in a positive mood. She is very enthusiastic.

Suddacharige has requested a 15,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya is 41 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Har-Horin "soum" (an administrative district) of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for 12 years. Her daughters, Altangerel and Narmandah, both attend university.
