CLIENTE SOLTERO CON NEGOCIO DE TRANSPORTE PROPIO EL CUAL ADQUIRIO PRODUCTO DE SU  ESFUERZO Y CON COLABORACIÓN DE SUS PADRES, CON 3 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA CON LA CMAC - ICA , TIENE CASA PROPIA LA CUAL UNA PARTE FUE CONSTRUIDA CON EL MODULO DEL ESTADO, ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA YA QUE CON SUS AHORROS A PODIDO AVANZAR CON LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DE SU CASA Y COMPRAR ALGUNOS ARTEFACTOS.
 SOLICITA CREDITO PARA MANTENIMIENTO DE SU MOTO
texts.en:
Jose is single and has a transportation business which he acquired with the help of his parents. He has been working with CMAC - ICA for three years. He has his own home which is partially built as a modular home. He is very enterprising and has been able to use his income to continue construction on his home and buy a few more artifacts. He is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with six children and all her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Sarah takes care of additional family members. She owns a charcoal store in Makerere and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She works six days a week.

Besides this grocery shop, she also owns a popcorn machine.  

Sarah receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for four years. She has been with MCDT for many years, servicing her third loan.  Besides this charcoal business, she also sells snacks like chips and sausages.  She wants to use the loan to buy bags of charcoal. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and start going directly to villages.  She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving loans to women in groups.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: D. Antoinette est née en 1965 à Lokossa au Bénin. Mariée à TOSSAVI Romain, Antoinette est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Antoinette n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de 15 ans que Antoinette prépare et vend de la nourriture (igname préparé) de façon ambulante. Antoinette achète son produit à Comé et à Lokossa au Bénin. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts à ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
D. Antoinette was born in 1965 in Lokossa in Benin.  Married to TOSSAVI Romain, she is the mother of four children, who all attended school.  The family has been living for twelves years in Agla, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antoinette helps out her husband and, along with him, makes sure that the various family expenses are covered.  Antoinette never attended school.  For nearly fifteen years, she has been making and selling food (cooked yams) door to door.  She purchases her supplies in Comé and in Lokossa, in Benin.  She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which have all been repaid.  With the aim of bolstering her business and growing her customer base, Antoinette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of yams

loans.name: Luz Yessenia

texts.es:
Luz tiene 28 años de edad, es separada y tiene una hija de cuatro años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años tiene instalado en casa de sus padres un ambiente en donde brinda servicio de alquiler de videojuegos (play station) a los niños y jóvenes de la zona. Este negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de diversos recursos que le permitan mantener a su hija y ayudar con los gastos de la economía de su familia. Ella también percibe ingresos vendiendo productos cosméticos en base a pedidos.

El continuo uso brindado a los equipos con los que brinda su servicio han hecho que estos empiecen a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento. Luz no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento de sus equipos (televisores y equipos de videojuegos).

Luz es una joven que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de la dificultades y de su condición de madre soltera, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hija una buena educación.
texts.en:
Luz is 28 years old, is separated and has a four year old daughter. She lives with her parents in Chiclayo and has a video game system (play station) rental business set in her parents’ home. She rents to the kids in her zone. This business was born out of necessity to earn an income so that she can support her daughter and help with the household expenses. She also earns income by taking order for cosmetics. The continuous use of the equipment with which she provides service has caused faults that urgently need to be repaired for proper functioning. Luz does not have sufficient capital for this, so she has seen the need to request this first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. She will use the money for repair and maintenance on her equipment (televisions and video game systems). Luz is a young lady who has learned how to get ahead, despite her difficulties and situation as a single mother. Her greatest desire is to provide her daughter with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equipment repair

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she stays with two people. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Christine takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family. Christine owns a stall in Owino market, selling second hand clothing. She works six days a week. Christine receives at least 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Christine has been in this business for two years and her business challenges include the rainy season, because she works from an open place, and seasonality. Christine has been with MCDT for six months, servicing her second loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes for resale. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start buying bales of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Amistad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del banco comunal  Amistad son mujeres trabajadoras, persistentes  que buscan día a día sobresalir junto a su familia, éste banco se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca urbe  admirada por propios y extraños por  sus edificaciones coloniales principalmente el centro histórico, la hermosa arquitectura de sus templos, sus paisajes naturales propios de la serranía y su  gente cálida y acogedora al turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora Blanca Z.  tiene 37 años, vive en unión libre  con su esposo que trabaja como chofer de un camión,  gestó tres hijos que se encuentran de 17 y 4 años y el último de dos meses de nacido, su hijo mayor estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que habitan es de su suegra  pues aún no  tienen casa propia.
 
Blanca comenzó a trabajar en un gabinete de belleza a sus 17 años  y  como le gusta este arte  ingresó a una Academia de belleza ahora cuenta con  su local propio en el cual trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9 a.m. a 9 p.m.

Fue invitada por una clienta de su local a formar parte de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo trabajando con  los créditos de  la fundación y está muy contenta porque éstos  le han  beneficiando para el incremento de su negocio, con el  nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar una nueva maquina para cortar el cabello, tijeras, tintes, tratamientos  y otros artículos que le hacen falta, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.

La señora  Angélica Gutiérrez tiene 33 años,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  con sus padres que cuidan una fábrica y allí les han proporcionado vivienda para ella, su  pareja y dos de  sus  hijos de 10 y 5 años  ya que la mayor de 15 ya es casada y vive independiente  pero sigue estudiando a distancia. Su pareja  trabaja pastando (enluciendo)  paredes de las casas donde lo contratan.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de zapatos y ropa desde muy joven y ya lleva en el negocio 15 años, no tiene un lugar específico en donde vende por lo que recorre toda la ciudad vendiendo a sus clientes y conocidos, trabaja todos los días y no tiene un horario determinado.

Hace cuatro años formó parte de  otro grupo pero separó, ahora va en su segundo ciclo en éste equipo de mujeres  motivada por su sobrina,    los créditos obtenidos los ha invertido en su  hogar y negocio y  con el  nuevo crédito realizado va adquirir  pantalones, camisas, blusas,  zapatos, ropa interior, etc. para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene como meta llegar a tener un carro ya que le hace falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Amistad" are hardworking, persistent women who seek daily to advance their families economically. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, a city admired at home and abroad for its colonial buildings, historic center, the beautiful architecture of its churches, its natural mountain landscapes and its people, who are warm and friendly to domestic and foreign tourists. Blanca Z., 37, is in a common-law marriage. Her husband is a truck driver, and they have 3 children, aged 17, 4 and 2 months. Their oldest son studies in a school in the city. They live in her mother-in-law's house, as they do not yet have their own home. Blanca began working at a beauty parlor when she was 17, and since she enjoyed this work she entered a beauty academy. Now she has her own place where she works from Monday to Saturday from 9 am to 9 p.m. She was invited by a customer of her business to become a part of this beautiful group of women. The group is now in its 3rd loan cycle with the foundation, and is she is very content because these loans have helped her to grow her business. With the new loan requested she will buy a new machine for cutting hair, scissors, dyes, treatments and other items that she needs. Her biggest dream is to own her own home. Angélica Gutiérrez, 33, lives in the city of Cuenca with her parents, who attend to a factory. They have provided a home for her, her partner, and two of their children aged 10 and 5 years. The oldest child is 15 and is already married and lives independently, but is continuing to study via distance learning. Her husband works plastering the walls of houses where he works by contract. Angélica has sold shoes and clothing since she was very young; she has had this business for 15 years. She does not have a specific place to sell her items, so she goes around the whole city selling to her customers and acquaintances. She works every day and does not have a set schedule. Four years ago she joined another group but left. Now she is in her 2nd loan cycle with this team of women, which she was motivated by her niece to join. The money borrowed previously was invested in her home and her business. With this new loan she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, shoes, underwear, etc., for women, men and children. Her goal is to eventually have a car, which is something that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting hair, scissors, dyes, treatments, and pants, shirts, blouses,  and underwear for women, men and children

loans.name: El Eden 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group El Eden (Eden), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing a large quantity of silver from which to make her jewelry. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies for them and investing in her home by finishing the construction (which will include a small area to house her shop). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase silver

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Venicia, 42, is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic.  She is the coordinator of a group called Canal de Bendicion (Channel of Blessing).  Her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Venicia and her husband live with their three children in a simple home in a Batey near La Romana.  Bateyes are very poor.  The small rurl community was built by sugar companies for their field workers.  Life is extremely difficult, with no potable running water, daily power outages and inadequate access to health-care.  Despite these difficulties, Venicia runs a successful “colmado” (small corner store).  Colmados sell everything from bread to batteries.  With this loan, Venicia will buy rice, oil, flour, chicken, soft drinks, meat, and fish to sell.

This is Venicia’s fourth loan from Esperanza International.  She hopes to continue to growth her business.  Venicia’s profits help her provide for her family and cover many basic necessities around the house and for her children’s schooling.  Venicia hopes to continue growing and improving her business, taking out larger and larger loans over time.
----------------------------------------
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Venicia and the Canal de Bendicion group!

loans.use: Food and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Abla Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail des articles de mercerie, elle fait ce commerce depuis près de 10 ans déjà. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son stock actuel est en baisse elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
This is a woman who has an income-generating retail business in sewing supplies.  She has been in this business from nearly ten years already.  She gets her supplies in Lomé.  Her stock right now is low.  She would like to stock up again.  This is the reason why she's requesting a loan from WAGES, so as to buy a variety of sewing goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sewing items

loans.name: Lucien

texts.fr: G. Lucien est né en 1949 à Abomey, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Marié à AFEDJOU Odette, Lucien est père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Lucien vit depuis une vingtaine d'année à fidjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Depuis huit ans, Lucien exerce comme activité, la vente de sacs de maïs à son domicile. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Lucien contribue efficacement aux charges familiales. Lucien s'approvisionne à Kandi, dans le Nord du Bénin. Lucien a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit à ALIDé, et l'a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Lucien sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
G. Lucien was born in 1949 in Abomey, in Zou County, Benin.  Married to AFEDJOU Odette, he is the father of five children, who have all attended school.  He has been living for about twenty years in Fidjrossè, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  For eight years, he has been operating a business selling sacks of corn at his house.  He gets his supplies in Kandi, in northern Benin.  Thanks to the revenues from his business, he is effectively helping to cover family expenses.  Lucien has already benefited from one ALIDé loan and has repaid it.  Facing the growing number of customers of his, he is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1950 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin, H. Célestine est une veuve et mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Célestine vit avec ses enfants au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis huit ans que Célestine s'est installée dans ce quartier. Seule Célestine assure les différentes charges de la famille. Célestine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Célestine vend du gazoil et du pétrole, depuis douze ans. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Célestine sollicite un deuxième prêt afin de renforcer son activité et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1950 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin, Célestine H. is a widow and the mother of six children, all having attended (or still attending) school. She lives with her children in the Aïbatin borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She settled in this area eight years ago, and is the only provider for family expenses. Célestine has never attended school. To meet her needs, she has been selling diesel fuel and gasoline for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Celestine has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to reinforce her activity and increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerrycans of diesel fuel and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wood, nails and paint to make home improvements.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza, 43, is a borrower who lives near L. Romana, Dominican Republic.  She is the coordinator for her group called Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo (Christ and Our Strength).  Her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maritza is a single mother who lives with her two children in a simple home near L. Romana.  Their small rural community was built by sugar companies for their field workers.  Life is extremely difficult, with no potable running water, daily power outages and inadequate access to health care, among other dangers.  Despite these difficulties, Martiza runs a successful small business selling clothing in her community. With this loan, she will purchase undergarments, shoes, and pants to sell at a small markup.

This is Maritza’s second loan with Esperanza International.  She hopes to continue to grow her business.  Maritza is excited to continue investing in her business and family with the profits she earns.  Her profit will help her make household purchases like food and school supplies for her children.  Maritza is now confident that her children will have bright futures; a luxury she did not have before receiving access to business loans.
----------------------------------------
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maritza and the Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo group!

loans.use: Buy shoes, pants, and undergarments to resell.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 1 Group

texts.en:
Juan is the coordinator of his group: Plan de Lucha (Battle Plan), and his story is representative of his group members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general.  Many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti.  His group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor where running water and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home in a simple, rented structure with his wife and child.

Juan is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza after successfully repaying his previous loans and growing his business.  He plans to use this loan to purchase more product from the farmers and trading it in the main markets.  He will use the profits to invest in shoes for his children and a washing machine for his home.   His long term goal is to own his own home.  He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Akoeba

texts.fr:
Cette  dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus pour la confection de pantalon et chemise, elle expose ses marchandises au bord de la route, ainsi elle attire plus le regard des passants. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adawlato, faisant face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une demi-balle de tissu pantalon et d’un quart de balle de tissu chemise.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady generates income by reselling clothing fabric for shirts and pants. She offers her wares from the roadside, to attract more attention. She gets her supplies from the Adawlato market. As she is currently confronted with a reduced stock of supplies, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy half a bale of cloth for pants and one fourth bale of cloth for shirts. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Danelia es una señora muy dedicada al trabajo, tiene la edad de 37 años, procreo una hija, el cual la criado sola. Aun no ha logrado tener su propia casa, vive donde su mama, pero su anhelo es poder hacer su casa es por eso con el salario de su trabajo el cual se desempeña como secretaria desde hace nueve años, ha logrado comprar materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento para comenzar a construir su casa. Con este financiamiento quiere pagar la mano de obra el cual no cuenta con dinero en efectivo. Contenta por que lograra cumplir parte de su sueño. Sus planes es seguir laborando y seguir manteniendo estable su puesto. Ya que esta difícil el encontrar empleo hoy en dia.
texts.en:
Danelia is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She is 37 years old and has one daughter, whom she raised alone. As she has not managed to have her own house, she lives with her mother. However her wish is to be able to have a house. It is for this that, with the wages from her job as secretary the past nine years, she has managed to buy construction materials such as concrete blocks, sand, and cement to begin constructing the house. With this financing, she would like to pay workers who do not accept money in cash. She is pleased because she has managed to complete part of her dream. Her plans are to continue working and continue maintaining her position, as it is difficult to find employment these days.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase part of the construction materials and pay workmen

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima M. est un jeune commerçant  de 30 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Il gère une quincaillerie et vend différentes  sortes de matériels. Monsieur M. est en même  temps entrepreneur dans le bâtiment. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour l’achat de matériels  en vue de renforcer le stock de son magasin et aussi d’augmenter les variétés  a offrir a la clientèle. Ce crédit pourra avoir comme impact d’accroitre ses revenus  pour lui permettre de mieux gérer  ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima M. is a 30-year-old merchant who lives in Camberene. He runs a hardware store and sells different types of equipment. Mr. M. is also a building contractor. He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy equipment that will expand his stock of supplies and increase the variety of items he can offer his customers. The impact of this loan will be to increase his income so that he can better manage his social needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth, 24, is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic.  She is the coordinator for her group called Mujeres con Esperanza (Women with Hope).  Her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ruth lives with her husband in a simple home in Santiago, the second-largest city of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic is overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, daily power outages and inadequate access to health care.  Despite these difficulties, Ruth runs a successful small business repairing washing machines. With this loan, she will purchase new machine parts and tools to advance her business.

This is Ruth’s third loan with Esperanza International.  She hopes to continue growing her business.  With her profits, Ruth hopes to expand her home.  Construction is done in stages as money becomes available.  Ruth should have enough money soon for the new addition.  She is excited to continue taking out bigger loans to improve her business and home life.
----------------------------------------------
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ruth and the Mujeres con Esperanza group!

loans.use: Buy washing machine parts and tools.

loans.name: El Samaritano 3,5 Group

texts.en:
Julissa is the coordinator of her group called El Samaritano (The Samaritan).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). 

Her group is located in a rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Julissa makes her home here in a simple structure.  She is a single mother with two children.

Julissa is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy underwear in bulk and then resell it at retail prices in the main market.  Julissa will use the profits to support her children by purchasing shoes and by repairing the floor in her home.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Buy underware in bulk and resell it.

loans.name: Carmen Pastora

texts.es: Doña carmen se dedica al comercio, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, junto  a su familia dos hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, y su esposo que trabaja como conductor de transporte pesado. Ella desde hace varios años logro poner una pulpería con ahorros propios y financiamiento inicio. Lo que ha  sido su  fuente de entradas para pagar gastos básicos, y lo necesario para sus hijos, pues con el dinero que da su esposo compra la alimentación y cubre otras necesidades. Con este préstamo invertirá en alimentos para la venta como: granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, golosinas, y otros productos para mejorar la demanda de sus clientes. Sus planes es poder comprar vitrinas para exhibir mas sus productos, a si como mejorar dos cuarto que alquila el cual le genera otras entradas y que son de gran  beneficios para ir aumentando su capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Carmen is involved in sales. She is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación with her family. She has two children who are pursuing their studies, and her husband works as a driver of heavy freight. Several years ago, she managed to start a local store with her own savings and initial financing. This has been her source of income for paying basic expenses and what her children need. With the money that it gives, her husband buys food and covers other necessities. With this loan, she will invest in food to sell, such as basic grains, dairy products, meats, candy, and other products, to improve the demand of her customers. Her plans are to be able to by cabinets to display more merchandise, and to improve the two rooms that she rents, which generate other income and are a great benefit for continuing to increase her resources.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, dairy products, candy, meat, and other products to broaden merchandise

loans.name: Cotoqueños Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo conformado de 10 personas, los cuales viven en el municipio de Cotoca de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, este grupo fue formado por la Sra. Cinthia, la cual invito a las demas para que participaran en el grupo, actualmente se encuentra en su primer ciclo ya que la agencia de PAMPA DE LA ISLA que se encuentra camino al municipio de Cotoca  es una agencia nueva de Emprender en la ciudad de Santa Cruz. 

La Sra. JOVITA.- es la presidenta del banco comunal la cual fue elegida a votacion en el grupo, ella vive en Cotoca, cuenta con casa propia, en el barrio 15 de diciembre, en la cual vive con su nieto de 5 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pero ellos se encuentran fuera del pais, doña Jovita se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años,ademas tambien cuenta con dos motocicletas las cuales  hacen servicio de mototaxi, el prestamo solicitado sera detinado para la compra de linea para una de sus motos, ya que la misma se encuentra trabajando sin pertenecer a una linea de transporte y asi tener mejores ingresos e incrementar su capital de trabajo.

La Sra. MIRTHA.- fue elegida como tesorera del grupo, esta sra, es muy activa y sociable, le gusta trabajar en grupos, doña Mirtha y su esposo se dedican al  Periodismo y ademas son locutores de un programa en la radio denominada" radio cruceña" el cual es realizado por las mañana, viven en el bariro San Antonio en anticretico a lado de la misma radio tienen  un  hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, su deseo de estos sres. es comprarse su lote y construir su casita y como todo padre ver porfesional a su hijo, el prestamo solicitado sera para la compra de un equipo de computacion el cual les sera muy util para el trabajo que desempeñan, ellos estan muy agradecidos con Emprender, por la confianza brindada al haberles otorgado un prestamo.
texts.en:
This is a group comprised of 10 people, who live in the municipality of Cotoca, in the city of Santa Cruz. This group was formed by Mrs. Cinthia, who invited the others to participate in the the group. Presently it is in its first cycle as the branch PAMPA DE LA ISLA, which is located in the municipality of Cotoca, a new branch of Emprender in the city of Santa Cruz. Mrs. JOVITA is the president of the comunal bank, who was elected by voting within the group. She lives in Cotoca. She has her own house in the neighborhood of 15 of December, where she lives with her five year old grandchild. She has two children, but they live abroad. Mrs. Jovita has sold clothing for two years, and also owns two motorcycles which provide a motor-taxi service. The requested loan will be used to purchase a line for one of her motorcycles, as it is operating without belonging to a transportation line, so as to have better earnings and increase her income. Mrs. MIRTHA. was elected treasurer of the group. This women is very active and sociable. She enjoys working in groups. Mrs. Mirtha and her husband work in journalism and in addition are commentators for a radio program called "radio cruceña," which broadcasts in the morning. They live in the neighborhood of San Antonio in an anticretico next to the same radio station. They have a son who is studying at the university. Their wish is to purchase for themselves a lot and construct a small house, and like very parent, see their son become a professional. The requested loan will be for the purchase of computor equipment which will be very useful to them in carrying out their work. They are very thankful to Emprender for the trust offered in having granted them a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing work income

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor mas conocido como silvio, vive en la cuidad de Santa Cruz-Bolivia por la zona de los lotes Barrio Pedro Diez, cuenta con un anticretico en la cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. El Sr. Victor tiene la actividad de pintor albañil, el cual actualmente se encuentra realizando el pintado de un inmueble por la av. Santos Dumont, el prestamo solicitado sera detinado en la compra de materiales para realizar su trabajo, el mismo que quiere comprar (6 valdes de pinturas, pigmentos, varniz); ya que esta recibiendo bastantes solicitudes de trabajos, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para poder llegar a comprarse su lote y construir su propia casita. 

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor is best known as Silvio. He lives in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, in a zone of lots in the Pedro Diez neighborhood. He has an anticretico home, in which he lives with his wife and three school-aged children. Mr. Victor is employed as a painter of brickwork, and is currently carrying out the painting of a property on Avendia Santos Dumont. The requested loan will be used for the purchase of materials to do his work. He would like to buy the following: 6 buckets of paint, pigments, and varnish. As he is receiving enough requests for work, his aim is to continue working to be able to buy his lot and build his own small house. He is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for trust offered in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Materials

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui Group

texts.en:
Hilover is the coordinator of her group, Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring the capital city. Here, crime is rampant and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Hilover is excited to be taking her third loan  with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling tennis shoes by purchasing two crates of tennis shoes to sell in her community. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her own home and saving toward the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Creciendo En Fe 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo en Fe. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Maria is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a pharmacy by purchasing medicines for colds, fever and diarrhea. She will use the profits to save toward her long-term goal of purchasing her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Medicines to supply her pharmacy

loans.name: Sabina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 40 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 8 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que hace un año empezara a trabajar en la venta de  golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en la parte exterior de su vivienda. Ha instalado una pequeña mesa donde muestra a sus clientes los productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en los gastos de crianza de sus hijos y en ayudar a solventar la economía de su familia.

Sabina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para poder instalar una bodega dentro de su vivienda, lo que le permitirá ofrecer mas variedad de productos y percibir mayores ganancias. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piesa invertir en la compra de mas productos y asi lograr su objetivo.

Sabina es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de dalir adelante y de brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria y hacerse conocida en la zona donde vive. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona amable y responsable.
texts.en:
Sabina is 40 years old, seperated, and has two children ages 18 and 8. She lives in her parents house located in the district of Cayaltí, an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

The necessity to support her family drove her to start working a year ago selling sodas and sweets outside of her house. She has installed a small table where she shows her clients the products she offers. She uses the income to raise her children and helping to settle the family bills.

Sabina would like to expand her business buy buying more products then installing a store inside of her house which would allow her to offer a greater variety of products and make more money. To do this she is asking for her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 700 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying more merchandise to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying snacks, sodas, and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Luis de 46 años y sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor para continuar trabajando. En la ciudad de Tarma, “La Estancia“ es una de las pastelerías mas conocidas y concurridas, negocio que le pertenece a Celia, en donde prepara sus deliciosas tortas y pasteles, por lo que son muy apreciados por sus asiduos compradores, quienes han hecho que su negocio sobre salga de entre los demás. Ella aprendió la repostería de los conocimientos de sus padres, quienes antiguamente tenían un horno, por lo que hacían pan y pasteles para vender. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que muestra en su panadería, Es así que lleva 6 años en este negocio, siendo lo más difícil de su trabajo trasnocharse para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Mas adelante espera abrir al costado de su pastelería una pizzería, de eso modo le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Este es au cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. Dentro de su banco comunal, es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá para arreglar un horno especial para preparar pizzas, herramienta que le ayudará a comenzar con su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Celia is a very cheerful and hard-working 41-year old woman who lives in a rented house with her 46 year old husband Luis and their two children who are the driving force for her to continue working. Their bakery "La Estancia" is one of the best known and popular bakeries in the city of Tarma, where she prepares the delicious cakes and pies that their regulars appreciate and that make their business stand out among the others. Celia learned to bake pastries from her parents who used to make bread and pies in their oven to sell. What she enjoys most is to decorate the cakes. She has the patience and the touch to make the beautiful decorations that typify her bakery. She has been in this business for six years, and the most difficult part is to be up all night to fill the orders that she has. However, to move forward she hopes to open a pizzería to the side of her pastry shop to help improve her income. This is Celia's fourth loan with MFP. She has always demonstrated punctuality in her payments and hopes to do so again now. She is a responsible member of her communal bank, which makes her very dear to her partners. With the 2000 nuevo soles that she asks for, she will repair a special oven to prepare pizzas, a tool that will help her start her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a pizza oven

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo (56) y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.El negocio al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. cuyes, gallinas y patos, a los cuales tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad, donD. tiene muchos clientes y las ganancias diarias son muy buenas. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo y los dos se han encargado D. sacar adelante el negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño; lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio D. la ganadería.Este es el sétimo préstamo D. Rosa, y  sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old, a very hardworking and happy woman who lives in her own home with her husband Hugo (56). Her biggest wish is to grow old peacefully. Rosa makes a living selling guinea pigs, chickens and ducks, which she has well taken care of and fed. Their stand is located in a wholesale market of the city, where she has many customers and her daily income is very good. She works with her husband and the two of them have kept the business going. What she likes the most about her work is the feeding of the animals, as she raises them with much affection. She has been in this business for 4 years and she finds most difficult the having to spend all day at her stand waiting for customers. In the future she would like to get into the cattle business. This is the seventh loan for Rosa and she knows that she has to pay her installments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very happy and responsible member of her community bank. She will use the requested thousand new Soles to purchase feed for her young animals, she know that she needs to keep them well fed if she wants to get a good price for them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for animals.

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “ACUARIO”, está conformado por 7 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en la zona D. Sol D. Vitarte, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad recientemente.
Nelva quien es socia del grupo, tiene 57 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Nelva asume el cargo D. presidenta. DesD. hace 16 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa como ambulante, alquila cuartos en su vivienda, además tiene una combi el cual lo alquila para transporte. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado construir su vivienda. El gran sueño D. Nelva es tener un local propio D. ropa, crecer  con su negocio,  llegar a  tener más mercadería y diversificar sus productos.
El préstamo otorgado será utilizado en la implementación D. un cuarto para alquiler, comprando puertas y ventanas. Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The communal savings bank, “ACUARIO” is comprised of 7 members, who are very enterprising and live in the southern area, Sol D. Vitarte, Ate district, department of Lima. They work with EDAPROSPO (Kiva’s field partner)-recent prosperity.

Nelva is a part of the group; she is 57 years old, married and has 3 children who are independent. Nelva is the president of the group. For 16 years she has sold clothing as a street vendor, she rents rooms in her home, and has a van which she rents as transportation. With the efforts of her hard work she has been able to build her home. Nelva’s biggest dream is to have her own clothing stall, grow her business and to have more merchandize and have a variety of products.

The loan will be used to make a room to rent by buying doors and windows. Our members are grateful for the support and the initiative for their organization as a communal savings bank and they promise to meet the established payments in the dates agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a room to rent by buying doors and windows.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela tiene 31 años, casada y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, mientras que su esposo, quien es comerciante, vive en Lima, pero cuando puede los visita. Para ella lo más importante es mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que tiene su restaurante, establecimiento que es muy concurrido en la ciudad de Tarma. Todos los días sus clientes acuden a su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una muy buena cocinera, ya que desde pequeña lleva esa afición, que hasta el momento cocina con mucho esmero y dedicación. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su establecimiento, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola. Más adelante, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así poder darles más comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por lo que espera continuar siendo muy puntual como en anteriores créditos. Por otro lado se siente muy a gusto trabajar con su grupo comunal, en donde es muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar en mayor proporción, debido a que tiene más demanda de su comida.
texts.en:
Guísela is 31 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her two dear children. Her husband, who is a merchant, lives in Lima but visits them when he can. The most important thing for her is to improve their quality of life. That is why she has a restaurant. It is a very well frequented establishment in the city of Tarma. Her customers come to her restaurant every day to taste the delicious menus she prepares. She is a very good cook. She has been very enthusiastic about it since she was little and until now cooks with great care and dedication. She has been working as a cook for 5 years. She thinks the most difficult part is waiting on all the people that come into her establishment since she has to work alone a lot of the time. She hopes to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant in the future and make her customers more comfortable this way. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue to be punctual as with previous loans. On the other hand she feels very happy working with her village group where she participates a lot. She is applying for a thousand PEN to buy more ingredients in order to cook in greater proportion since her food is in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients to prepare more food.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío es una mujer proactiva, a sus 38 años, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 12,  trabaja con EDAPROSPO - prosperidad desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de comida en un local por las tardes, el cual lleva por nombre de “VIRGEN DE COCHARCAS”, desde hace 7 años se inicio vendiendo como ambulante, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado construir la vivienda de su mama, comprarse un terreno, el cual le falta construir, y  mejorar su calidad de vida. 
El gran sueño de Rocío, es construir su vivienda y ampliar su negocio. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de mercadería (arroz, papa condimentos, etc.). Rocío se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a salir adelante y a prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Rocío is a proactive woman. She is 38 years old and is a single mother of one 12 year old son. She works with EDAPROSPO - prosperity since 6 years ago. In the afternoons, she sells food in a pub, which is called “VIRGEN DE COCHARCAS.” Seven years ago, she started selling street food. With the force of her daily labor, she managed to build the home of her mother, buy herself a lot, which lacks a house, and better her quality of life. Rocío's great dream is to build a home and expand her business. The recent loan that was granted will be invested in the purchase of merchandise (rice, potatoes, condiments, etc.). Rocío is very thankful for all of the help offered, because it has help her move forward and prosper with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (rice, potatoes, condiments, etc.)

loans.name: Iris Lourdes

texts.es: La Srta. Iris, vino a Emprender recomendada por su hermana  Norma quien es cliente antigua, ella se dedica al tejido de chambritas (chompas pequeñas de lana) y mantillas para bebé, en esta actividad se encuentra más de 6 años y en estos dos últimos años se dedica con mayor interés a la casa, ya que tienen a su madre enferma y a manera de atenderla en los cuidados que necesita, ella se dedica a la elaboración de esas prendas, tanto a mano como a máquina, cuando tiene muchos pedidos le ayudan sus hermanas, ella acomoda sus trabajos por las tiendas de la calle 21 de San Miguel, en especial en la tienda libreria que tiene su hermana, ella vive en la zona de Irpavi, donde generalmente viven familias de militares, es una zona calurosa y tranquila, ella no tiene aún familia propia, vive en la casa de los padres juntamente con sus tres hermanos,  pero todos tienen actividades propias e independientes, compartiendos los gastos familiares entre ellos; por último podemos decir que es una persona responsable y anteriormente fue tambien cliente Kiva y no tuvo contratiempos en sus pagos. Con el dinero del credito comprara lana para los tejidos que realiza, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Iris came to Emprender, recommended by her sister Norma, who is a former client. She knits chambritas (small wool sweaters) and baby clothes. She has been in this work for more than 6 years. In these last two years, she has been occupied more at home, as she has an ill mother, and in this way attends to her with the care needed. Iris makes garments by hand and by machine. When she has many orders, her sisters help her. She puts her work in the stores on Calle 21 of San Miguel, in particular in the bookstore that her sister has. She lives in the area of Irpavi, where military families generally live. It is a warm and laid-back area. She does not yet have her own family. She lives in the home of her parents together with her three siblings. However, everyone has their own activities and independence, sharing the family expenses among themselves. Finally, we can say that she is a responsible person, previously was also a cliente of Kiva, and did not have setbacks in her payments. With the loan money, she will buy wool for the knitting she does. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
L. señora AdeL. es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 45 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 12, 8 y 3 años, se dedica a L. venta D. variedad D. productos en una librería – bazar llamado “NICOL”, desD. hace 11 años, se inicio con un puesto en el Centro Comercial D. Gamarra vendiendo prendas D. vestir, hasta que L. desalojaron y se vio obligada a poner el bazar en su vivienda, además cuenta con un locutorio desD. hace 3 años llamado “NAYELY”.
AdeL. nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido D. mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, sus ingresos cubren los gastos D. pago D. servicios, alimentos. El gran sueño D. AdeL. es implementar más su negocio.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar mercadería (cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc.).
AdeL. agradece toda L. ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
AdeL. is 45-year-old married entrepreneur. She has three children, age 12, 8 and 3. For 11 years, she has been selling products at a bookstore in the Nicol bazaar. She started out selling clothes in Gamarra's Commercial Centre, but had to move her shop to her home after she was evicted. She also worked in the Nayely call centre for three years. AdeL. says these loans have been very helpful. She has been able to improve her family's living conditions and raise their income enough to cover the cost of all the services and food they require. AdeL. wants to be able to put more into her business. Her new loan will go toward stationery supplies (notebooks, pens, books, etc.). She appreciates all the help she has received from the lenders who have allowed her to move forward. Because of their help, she has been able to use her loans carefully, grow her business, and grow with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stationery supplies

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario es cliente antiguo, trabajó con Emprender desde el año 2007,siempre trabajo con crédito individual, el se dedica al trabajo de cerrajeria, haciendo puertas, ventanas, rejas y todo tipo de trabajos, como arreglos de cocinas, hornos etc, es una persona muy dinámica, ya que se traslada de un lado a otro en busca de trabajos, él tiene un hijo que estudia y trabaja a la vez, la esposa es trabajadora del hogar en la zona de Achumani, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de Coqueni, que se encuentra al frente de la oficina de Emprender en  Chasquipampa, cruzando el rio, el crédito que ahora solicitó lo invertira en compra de fierro, electrodos y pintura para realizar un trabajo de puerta de garaje y de rejas según lo que comentó, el saca montos pequeños de acuerdo a su posibilidad de pago, en esta ocasión la esposa le colaborara en los pagos, ambas personas son responsables y comprometidas con la Institución. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mario is a long-standing Emprender client; he’s been collaborating with us since 2007, always with individual loans. He is a locksmith but makes lots of iron items like: doors, windows, grilles and all kinds of other jobs like stoves, ovens, etc. He is a very dynamic person who goes from place to place seeking work. He has a son that both works and goes to school. His wife is employed as a domestic in Achumani. They live in their own home in Coqueni, which is across from the Chasquipampa Emprender office, on the other side of the river. He commented that he will use the present loan to buy iron, electrodes and paint to do a job consisting of making a garage door and window grilles. He takes out small amounts according to his ability to pay; on this occasion, his wife will help with the repayments and both of them are responsible and committed to the Institution. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron for his shop.

loans.name: Macaria Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Macaria trabajó con Emprender desde el año 2002 en el grupo solidario KANTUTA, hasta el año 2006, en que se retiro debido a que se cambio de domicilio, ella actualmente tiene el negocio en la zona de Callapa, es una tienda bien surtida que atiende su mamá de lunes a viernes, ella se ocupa de la venta solo fines de semana, puesto que en la semana trabaja como empleada del hogar por la zona de Chasquipampa, ella vive juntamente con su esposo en la zona de Alto Irpavi, él es transportista del trufi 1 que es una linea de taxis del centro de la ciudad hacia la zona sur, tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, el esposo es quien lo deja y recoje colaborando con ella tanto en el cuidado como en los gastos del hogar, ella solicitó en esta oportunidad un credito en dólares para aumentar productos en su tienda, ya que por esta época comienzan los ensayos para la fiesta que se celebra en el mes de Mayo, es una cliente que demuestra responsabilidad y promete ser buena cliente en el trato individual.	Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Macaria collaborated with Emprender from 2002 until 2006 as a member of KANTUTA communal bank when she had to withdraw because she moved. Currently, she has a grocery store in the Callapa area. Her mother tends the store from Monday through Friday and she tends to it on weekends only because she works as a domestic during the week in Chasquipampa. She lives with her husband in Alto Irpavi; he is a trufi (collective minibus) driver on a route that goes from downtown to the southern part of the city. She has a small son who goes to school; her husband takes him and picks him up collaborating with her both in childcare and with household expenses. She is asking for funding in dollars to increase stock inventory in her store because this is the time when rehearsals for the May fiestas start. She is a client that has shown responsibility and she pledges to be a good individual client. She is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery stock items.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya N. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Rokhaya N. is 41 years old, divorced and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for two years and has been granted four loans, all reimbursed without a problem. She runs a small business selling firewood and charcoal. Her earnings enable her to take care of her children and meet her own needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Alfa Omega Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Alfa Omega, fue iniciado el 15 D. marzo del 2010, con el objetivo D. solicitar un crédito mancomunado para el incremento D. capital que les permitan incrementar sus ventas y utilidades, como líderes en la organización del grupo se encuentra:

La Sra. Juana, una persona destacada en su zona por su transparencia y liderazgo, es así D. esta manera elegida como presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento. Ella cuenta con una tienda D. barrio, un Internet al servicio D. su zona es una persona responsable y trabajadora, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para su tienda como refrescos, dulces y abarrotes.

Como tesorera  se encuentra la Señora Alejandra la misma que tiene al cuidado 2 hijos pequeños, y cuenta con un negocio ambulante en la venta D. cosméticos y el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. cosmeticos que se encuentran en promosion para despues venderlos al precio original. 

Todas las integrantes son personas que buscan la generación D. ingresos a través D. negocios informales que les permitan ganar un poco D. dinero para mejorar su calidad D. vida, sin descuidar a sus familia, también que esperan responder positivamente ante este primer crédito con el fin D. ser reconocidas como buenas clientes y confiables para así continuar con nuestra organización. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Alfa Omega communal bank was established on 15 March 2010 to seek funds to increase their sales and profits. The group leaders are: Juana, a person who stands out in the area for her leadership and openness, is elected president. She has a neighborhood grocery store and an Internet access service. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for her store, like: soft-drinks, candy and groceries. Alejandra is treasurer. She has two, small children under her care. She sells cosmetics door-to-door. She will use the funds to buy discounted cosmetics for later sale at full price. All the group members are people who seek to earn income through their informal businesses so that they can improve their quality of life while not neglecting their families. They also hope to respond positively to this initial loan in order to be seen as being responsible and trustworthy clients able to continue associated with our organization. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
Maria Veronica es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 5 años de edad en su vivienda ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace mas de un año. Empezó ofreciendo productos por catálogo en base a pedidos a sus vecinos y conocidos y luego pudo ampliar poco a poco su negocio, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño stock en su vivienda que ha podido adquirir con algunas de las ganancias obtenidas de ventas anteriores. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía de su familia por lo que ella da lo mejor de si para salir adelante.

María Verónica desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza de modo que pueda ampliar su stock y poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Verónica es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener una bodega mas grande donde pueda seguir ofreciendo sus productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
María Verónica is a 36 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 5, in her own home located in the District of Cayaltí. This community is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

María Verónica has been selling beauty products for more than a year. She began offering products by catalog and taking orders from her neighbors and acquaintances. Sometime later, she was able to gradually increase her business. María Verónica currently has a small stock of products at home, but she will be able to acquire some items with the earnings from her previous sales. This business is an important source of income for her to provide her family the best so that they can get ahead.

María Verónica wants to expand her business by purchasing more beauty products to increase her stock and offer a wider variety of merchandise to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve this goal.

María Verónica is a hardworking determined woman. Her dream is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and have a large store where she can offer her cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Jose Britaldo

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia de 66 años de edad, es separado y tiene tres hijos, vive solo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, conejos y patos desde hace mas de 10 años en su vivienda. El cría sus animales brindándoles alimento balanceado y pastos para luego ofrecerlos en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive, adicionalmente los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos cuando estos se los solicitan. Este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos por lo que trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera.

Los animales que ha estado criando han tenido mucha acogida entre sus clientes y cada vez la demanda esta aumentando, José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales pequeños para criarlos y venderlos además también quiere comprarles alimento balanceado, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Jose es una persona que gusta bastante de su trabajo, su negocio encuentra acogida gracias a que los vecinos conocen la responsabilidad con la que el lleva a acabo su trabajo. El es muy estimado por la zona en donde vive.
texts.en:
Jose is 66, separated, and the father of three children. He lives alone in the Cayaltí district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been working raising and selling guinea pigs, rabbits, and ducks for the past 10 years at his home. He raises the animals, giving them a balanced diet and grains, so that he can sell them to merchants who come to the area where he lives. He also sells to his neighbors upon request. This business is his only source of income so he tries to keep it up as best as he can. His animals have been very well liked by his customers and the demand keeps increasing. Jose wants to enlarge his business by buying young animals to raise and then sell. He also wants to buy balanced food. This is why he needs the loan of 1000 new soles for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa to help him succeed with his goal. Jose is a person who really likes his work. His business has been successful thanks to the neighbors who know the responsibility he takes with what he does. He is very respected in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, rabbits, and ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Mirian Fatima

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Fátima forma  parte del Banco Comunal Familiar en la localidad de Colorado en la provincia de Manabí en la región costera del Ecuador,  ella tiene  30 años  y es oriunda de Santa Ana en la misma provincia, se fue a vivir a Colorado desde hace 5 años, está casada hace 13 años, ella junto al esposo trabajan en la  compra  y venta de chanchos para lo cual  en su  propiedad tienen un espacio  para criarlos hasta venderlos,  llevan tres años en ésta actividad, nos comenta que antes de empezar en  este negocio ella  trabajaba en una fábrica de tagua hasta que un día decidió junto al esposo tener su propio negocio motivados por  algunos amigos.

Para poder trabajar el esposo compra  los chanchos pequeños para hacer la cría, lo grandes son para pesar por libra y vender en su casa, cada semana se sacan a vender los que ya están grandes  y cada tres meses los de cría.  El crédito solicitado es  para comprar más crías y alimento para su crianza y  seguir incrementando su negocio para de esta manera pagar sus créditos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Señora Mirian Fátima is a member of the Banco Comunal Familiar (Family Communal Bank) in the town of Colorado in Manabí province in Ecuador’s coastal region. She is 30 years old and is originally from Santa Ana in the same province. She went to live in Colorado 5 years ago. She has been married 13 years.

Her and her husband’s business is buying and selling pigs. They have space on their property for raising them until they are ready for sale. They have been in this business for three years and told us that before beginning it they worked in a factory making products from tagua (a type of palm nut). They did this until one day she and her husband decided, with the encouragement of some friends, to have their own business.

In order to start the business her husband purchased some piglets so that he could raise them. The large pigs are weighed and sold at their house. Each week they select mature pigs to sell. It takes three months to raise a pig.

The loan they are applying for is for the purchase of more piglets and the feed required to raise them. They want to continue increasing their business and, in this way, pay their loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and feed required to raise them.

loans.name: Patricia Felicita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar está ubicado  en la  localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi  en la Provincia de Manabí, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocio, algunos de ellos tienen almacenes de tela y otros se dedica a la artesanía.

En una reunión conversamos con la socia Patria y fue ella la encargada de comentarnos que el banco comunal esta bien organizado y las socias son buenas amigas  entre sí,  lo  que la motiva cada día hacer una socia responsable, ella esta casada tiene tres hijos el esposo es chofer profesional y juntos han podido sacar adelante al a familia.

Patria nos comentó que el con el crédito que recibe lo invertirá en el negocio que tienen que es la venta de ropa, es una comerciante informal y lo viene realizando desde hace algunos años, con los tres ciclos que lleva en la Fundación le ha ido muy bien y su negocio ha ido creciendo, cuando empezó lo hizo con poco capital y en los actuales momentos ella ya cuenta con un buen capital para poder comprar, pantalones, camisas, zapatillas entre otros, para poder vender tiene que salir a recorrer con su mercadería, cada quince días viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para surtir su negocio. El mayor sueño de la señora Patria es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Familiar (Community Bank for Families) is located in Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi, in the province of Manabí. In this area, the inhabitants have different businesses; some of them have fabric stores and others make handicrafts. In a meeting, we had a conversation with the member Patria and she shared with us that the community bank is well organized and the members are good friends with each other; this motivates her every day to be a responsible member. She is married and has three children; her husband is a professional chauffeur and together they have been able to get ahead in life with their family. Patria commented that she will invest the loan in her business of selling clothes; she is a street vendor and she has been doing for a few years. With the three loans from the Foundation, she has done really well and her business has been growing; she started with a little bit of capital and now has good capital to buy pants, shirts, and shoes, among others; to sell, she has to travel with her merchandise; every two weeks, she travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy merchandise for her business. Mrs. Patria’s biggest dream is for her business to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 40 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene una hija de 11 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, conocido en la región por sus danzas típicas afro – peruanas, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de nueve años a la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad en una bodega que tiene instalada en un ambiente de su vivienda. Ella ofrece todos los dias estos productos a sus clientes que le otorgan su preferencia gracias a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda. Como este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su menor hija, ella trata de dar todo de si para mantenerlo.

Adela desea incursionar en el negocio de preparación y venta de comida, la zona en donde vive es bastante turística, ya que existen varias ruinas coloniales y un museo afro – peruano, ella desea instalar un peuqño restaurante para atender a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que visitan el lugar. Por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y mobiliaio para poder lograr su objetivo.

Adela es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y otorgarle a su menor hija la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior que le garantice un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Adela, age 40, is divorced and has an 11 year old daughter. She lives in the Zaña district, which is well known in the region for its traditional Afro-Peruvian dances. She is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than nine years, Adela has been engaged in the sale of groceries and basic necessities in a shop she has set up in a space in her house. Every day she offers products to her customers, who prefer to shop with her thanks to the quality of her products and the good service she gives them. Since this business is the only source of income which she has to meet her personal expenses and support her small daughter she tries to give everything she can to keeping it up.

Adela wants to expand into food preparation and sales. The area where she lives gets a lot of tourists since it has colonial ruins and a Afro-Peruvian museum. She wants to install a small restaurant in order to serve the Peruvian and foreign tourists that visit the place.

This is why she is applying, for the first time, for a loan of 2000 new soles from Epydme Alternativa. She plans to invest the loan in materials and furnishings in order to achieve her goal.

Adela is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. Her greatest wishes are to continue growing as a businesswoman and to give her young daughter the opportunity to study for a superior career which will guarantee her a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furnishings and materials for installing a restaurant for tourists.

loans.name: Ena Paola

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne en la localidad Colorado en el  cantón Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí cerca al puerto Atunero Manta.

La señora Ena es socia desde hace 5 ciclos en la Fundación Espoir, ella es una joven madre de un niño de dos meses, se dedica a la venta ropa por catalogo y también compra ropa en Perú y Guayaquil según el pedido que tenga, contó  con el apoyo de su mamá en el tiempo que estaba en los meses de gestación  encargándose del negocio, ahora lo tiene que hacer ella aunque se le dificulta por el hecho que su bebe aún pequeño.

 Nuestra socia nos comenta  que ha sido de gran ayuda el trabajar con los créditos de la Fundación, su negocio ha ido creciendo muy bien y por ahora no ha tenido ningún tipo de problema con los pagos, con este nuevo crédito viajara  a Guayaquil para adquirir pantalones, Camisas, blusas, faldas, ropa interior para toda la familia  y  surtir su negocio  pues ya tiene varios pedidos pendientes por entregar.
texts.en:
The Familiar Communal Bank meets in the Colorado location. It is in the Montecristi region of the Manabí province, which is near the Atunero Manta port. Ena has been a member for five cycles with the Fundación Espoir. She is a young mother with a two month old child. She sells clothes by catalog. She also buys clothes in Perú and Guayaquil, according to the orders that she has. While she was pregnant, her mother helped her run the business. Now she has to do it even though it is difficult while her baby is still young. She tells us that working with the loans from the Fundación has been a big help. Her business has been growing very well. She has not had any problems with the payments. With this new loan she will travel to Guayaquil to get pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, and underwear for the whole family. She will stock her business as she has several pending orders to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, and underwear for the whole family

loans.name: Jahaira Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar lo encontramos en la  provincia de Manabí en la  localidad Colorado  situada a pocos minutos de distancia del  puerto pesquero de Manta, este es una parroquia donde sus habitantes en su gran mayoría son comerciantes.

Jahaira es soltera con 20 años de edad es la que se encarga de los gastaos del hogar, su papá esta delicado de salud y ella asumió la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus hermanos y padres, tuvo que dejar de estudiar para dedicarse al negocio de venta de productos de belleza de lunes a viernes y lo hace en la misma localidad donde vive, ella hace el pedido según lo que los clientes le soliciten a través del catálogo de Yanbal,  con el credito solicitado podrá  dar facilidad de pago a  los clientes  para lo cual va adquirir un pedido grande de éstos  productos  como perfumes, cremas, tratamientos.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Familiar (Community Bank for Families) is found in the province of Manabí, in the town of Colorado, a few minutes from the fishing port of Manta; this is a parish where most residents are merchants. Jahaira is single, 20 years old and is responsible for the household expenses. Her father is ill and frail so she assumed the responsibility of caring for her brothers and parents.
