She had to stop going to school so she could focus on selling beauty products Monday though Friday; she sells in the same town where she lives and she sells to order using the catalogue from Yanbal (a direct sales company). With the requested loan, she will be able to offer credit to her customers and she will place a large order of products such as perfumes, creams, and treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes, creams, treatments, etc.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, vive en el sector Santiago de Miraflores en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus danzas típicas de influencia afro – peruana, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Este negocio nació de la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante, ella trata de brindar productos de calidad y ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de buena acogida y ello la pone orgullosa y contenta.

Las continuas lluvias que se presentaron durante los pasados meses de verano en la zona norte del país hicieron que su vivienda se vea afectada en algunas partes, pensando en el bienestar y en la calidad de vida de sus hijos, ella desea hacer las reparaciones necesarias para mejorar su vivienda. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles 
Asunciona es una madre responsable y bastante luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad que les aseguren un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old, separated from her husband and has four children under her care. She lives in Santiago de Miraflores, district of Zaña, an area known for its Afro-Peruvian influenced dances located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than two years she has made a living selling grocery items out of a small store set up in her home. The business started out of the necessity to make headway for her children, for whom she always wants to provide the best. Asunciona tries to offer quality products and treat her customers well. Her store is well-maintained and it makes her proud and content. The continual rains in northern Peru that occurred during the past summer months have affected her home in some parts, and, thinking of her family's well being and quality of life, she has been hoping to make necessary repairs to improve her home. For this, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Asunciona is a responsible mother and quite a fighter, and her biggest goal is to provide her children with a better quality of life and a quality education to assure them a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs and perform maintenance on her home, which was damage by continual rain.

loans.name: Niño Jesus De Huaytara Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Niño Jesús de Huaytara inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son del distrito de Huaytara, Provincia de Huancavelica, ellas realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comida, golosinas, gaseosas, abarrotes entre otros.
Como es el caso de la Señora Estela que es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos varones, todos están estudiando, Estela inicio vendiendo anticuchos en la calle, actividad que realizaba solo por las tardes, ahora también vende cebiches por las mañanas, Estela con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara sillas, mesas y vitrina.
Los sueños de Estela es educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tener un restaurante en un local estable. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 7,800 soles.
texts.en:
The Niño Jesús de Huaytara (Baby Jesus of Huaytara) Community Bank took its first loan with 10 members who come from the district of Huaytara, province of Huancavelica. The members carry out different businesses such as selling food, snacks, soft drinks and groceries, among other items. Such is the case of Estela, who is a single mother with three sons, all in school. Estela started selling snacks in the street only in the afternoon, and now also sells ceviche (a popular regional dish made with fish and lime) in the mornings. With the loan, Estela plans to purchase tables, chairs and a display case. Estela's dreams are educate her sons so they become successful and to have a restaurant at a fixed location. The members will need different loan amounts such as 400, 600 and 1000 soles for a total of 7,800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and a display case

loans.name: Francisco Alejandro

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 55 años de edad, es separado y vive junto a dos hijos en el caserío Santa Catalina, una zona rural del distrito de Monsefú, conocido en el norte por sus festividades religiosas, se encuentra ubicado a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace cinco años aproximadamente, el cría vacas en el lugar en donde vive y las alimenta con pasto que el mismo siembra, diariamente extrae la leche que estas producen y la vende por litros en el mercado de la ciudad de Monsefú. Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta por lo que siempre da todo de si para salir adelante.

Pensando en ampliar su negocio Francisco ha estado ahorrando dinero para comprarse una vaca de raza que le garantice una abundante producción lechera, los ahorros que posee hasta ahora no son suficientes por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Fransisco es una persona que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, por lo que siempre le brinda la mayor atención posible, su sueño es poseer un establo bien equipado. El es una persona muy conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Francisco is 55 years old, separated from his wife and lives with his two children in the village of Santa Catalina, a rural area in the district of Monsefú known in the north for its religious festivals located 15 minutes from the city of Chicalyo. He has made a living raising livestock for approximately five years. He raises cows in the place where he lives and feeds them with grass he plants himself. He milks the cows daily and sells it by the liter in the city Monsefú. This business is the only source of income for Francisco, who always gives it his all to keep making headway. He is planning to expand his business, so he has been saving money to purchase another milk cow that would guarantee abundant milk production. What he has saved up until now is not enough, which is why he has seen the necessity to request a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. He is seeking 2,000 soles, which will help him achieve his objective. Francisco is a person who really enjoys the work he does, which is why he always gives it his all. His dream is to have a well-equipped stabled. He is a well-known and esteemed person in his area. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him a responsible and trustful person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow to expand his production

loans.name: Yrma Yuliana

texts.es: La Sra. Yrma  tiene 32  años de edad, es separada tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 10 años de edad,ella vive en casa propia de material noble de un piso  ubicado en el distrito de Parcona. Ella  cuenta con el ingreso del alquiler de una moto taxi y un automovil tico. Adicional a ello  tiene un pequeño negocio de la  venta de chicha de jora y mazamorra morada  en su casa, lo apoyan sus hijas. Ella se inicio en el negocio de alquiler de vehiculo hace 3 años. La Sra. Yrma tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de los tantos es que sus hijas sean profesioanles. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en el mantenimiento y pintura  de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Yrma is 32 years old and separated from her spouse. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 10. Her home is made of solid materials and located in the District of Parcona. Yrma generates an income by renting out a motorcycle taxi and a taxi cab. In addition, she manages a small business selling “chicha de jora” (a beverage made of corn) and purple “mazamorra” (corn porridge) from her home in order to support her daughters. She started her vehicle rental business three years ago.

Sra. Yrma has many dreams and goals. One of them is to see her daughters become professionals. With the money she requested, she will pay for maintenance and painting of her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & painting for her vehicle

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Huaytara Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Rosita de Huaytara inicia su primer ciclo con 12 socias.
Las socias son del distrito de Huaytara, Departamento de Huancavelica, ellas realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes, miel y librería, entre otros.
Como es el caso de la Señora Maribel que es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 01 y 06 años respectivamente, Maribel junto a su esposo iniciaron vendiendo miel de abeja en potes, con el tiempo alquilo un local en donde vende sus productos y también tiene colmenas de abejas. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de panales de abeja y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
Los sueños de Maribel es producir yogurt y vender mas productos derivados de la leche.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 6,000 soles.
texts.en:
The “Santa Rosita de Huaytara” Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with twelve members. They are from the District of Huaytara in the Department of Huancavelica. The members are engaged in different businesses such as selling groceries, honey, books, and other products.

Such is the case of Sra. Maribel. She is married and has two children, ages 1 and 6 respectively. Maribel and her husband began selling honey in containers. They eventually rented a space where they sell their products and also keep their beehives. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of honeycombs and display cases for exhibiting her products.

Maribel dreams of producing yogurt and selling more dairy products.

The members need different loan amounts such as 200 PEN, 400 PEN, 600 PEN, and 1000 PEN for a total of 6000 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase honeycombs & display cases

loans.name: Virgen Natividad Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Natividad inicia su primer ciclo con 8 socias.
Las socias son del distrito de Tambo, Provincia de La Mar, ellas realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, queso, leche, crianza de animales, entre otros.
Como es el caso de la Señora Ylda que es casada, tiene 5 hijos que están estudiando, Ylda se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno de otras personas, de las cuales obtiene leche para luego hacer quesos, su préstamo será invertido en el alquiler de terrenos de alfalfa para la alimentación del ganado.
Los sueños de Ylda es tener terreno suficiente para no alquilar.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 300 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 3,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Natividad communal bank is made up of 8 members who are beginning their first loan cycle. The members are based in the Tambo district in the province of La Mar. They have different businesses such as selling clothes, selling milk and cheese, and raising livestock. For example, Ylda is married and has 5 children who are in school. She makes a living raising cattle that belong to other people—she collects milk from the cows for making cheese. She is going to use the loan to rent alfalfa fields for feeding the cattle. Ylda’s dream is to have enough land so that she won’t have to rent anymore. The members need different loan amounts—such as 200 soles, 300 soles, 400 soles, and 1000 soles—which add up to a total of 3,600 soles for the group.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting alfalfa fields for feeding cattle

loans.name: Sol Naciente De Huaytara Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Sol Naciente de Huaytara inicia su primer ciclo con 9 socias.
Las socias son del distrito de Huaytara, Departamento de Huancavelica, ellas realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes, queso, comida, entre otros.
Como es el caso de la Señora Patrocinia que es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Patrocinia vende mazamorras, negocio que empezó a realizar cuando se separo de su esposo, para la manutención de su hogar, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de azúcar, leche, harina y esencias.
Los sueños de Patrocinia son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 3,300 soles.
texts.en:
The “Sol Naciente de Huaytara” (Rising Sun of Huaytara) Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with nine members. They are from the District of Huaytara in the Department of Huancavelica. The members are engaged in different businesses such as selling groceries, cheese, food, and other products.

Such is the case of Sra. Patrocinia. She is a single mother and has four children who are in school. Patrocinia sells “mazamorra” (corn porridge). She started her business after she separated from her husband so that she could maintain her household. This loan will be invested in the purchase of sugar, milk, flour, and essences. Patrocinia dreams that her children will study to become professionals.

The members need different loan amounts such as 200 PEN, 500 PEN, and 600 PEN for a total of 3300 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, milk, flour, and essences

loans.name: Lao

texts.en:
Mr. Lao N. is a married man of 37 years who lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. (Lao N. was not available for photographing so his wife is pictured instead.)       

To make a daily net profit, Lao N. works as a temporarily laborer in the construction filed and typically earns $2.50 or $3 per day. He is married to Sreythom, age 33, a garment worker. They have a school-aged child. 

Every day, the family finds it hard traveling to work because they have no vehicle. To solve this problem, Lao N. decided to ask for a loan of $800 to be used to buy a modern motorcycle, which will allow him and his family to commute to their work location or anywhere else.

loans.use: To buy a modern motorcycle

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr. S. is a modest person of 27 years who lives with his family in Phnom Penh city. He is married with three minor kids and a school-aged child. He helps be responsible for his family by working as a garment laborer, through which he can make around $100 salary a month. He is married to Sophal, 27, who works with him in the same industry. S. has no vehicle and he has always paid much money to taxis to take him to work. S. hopes to reduce this fee with a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorcycle for his travel needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años 
de edad. El  vive en casa de su cónyuge, El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos 
de los más de 5 años laborando como obrero de campo en los fundos de la zona. El tiene 
amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda. Policarpio  y su cónyuge sueñan con 
tener su casa propia ya que el terremoto les destruyo su vivienda. Policarpio sueña   
ver su casa construida y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder 
brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo, por lo que solicita el credito para realizarle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 23 years old, has lived in a common-law marriage for seven years and is the father of a 6-year-old boy. He lives in his partner's house. He bought a motortaxi with his savings earned from working for more than 5 years as a field laborer on the farms in his area. He has extensive experience in the service he provides. Policarpio and his spouse dream of owning their own house, because their home was destroyed by the earthquake. Policarpio is eager to see his house built and also to see his young son being able to study, thus providing him with safety and comfort. Policarpio applies for this loan to perform maintenance of his working tools.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his working tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Alma Doris

texts.es: Alma Doris C. D. A. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como empleado para una empresa privada, junto a sus dos hijos D. 14 y 4 años D. edad, quienes estudian y junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a ayudarle con el cuidado D. los niños. Alma posee un puesto ambulante D. tostadas D. plátanos, yuca, los cuales se preparan con limón, chile y sal. Este negocio es ambulante debido a que ella trabaja en conjunto con una feria, la cual se va moviendo D. pueblo en pueblo en donD. se estén celebrando las fiestas patronales del lugar. Alma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. yuca y plátanos, así mismo comprar aceite para freírlos y todos los aderezos que necesita. D. esta manera es como Alma se ha ganado la vida durante muchos años, es por ello que desea poder invertir un poco más en el negocio y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alma Doris C. D. A. is 46 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the district of San Salvador. She lives together with her spouse, who works as an employee for a private company. She also lives with her two children, ages 14 and 4, who are in school, and with her mother, who does the housework and helps her care for the children. Alma owns a street stand for fried plantains and yuca, which are prepared with lime, chili, and salt. This business is mobile, requiring that she work jointly with a fair which moves from village to village, in which the patron saint festivals of the region are celebrated. Alma is requesting a loan through which she can buy a larger quantity of yuca and plantains, as well as buy oil to fry them and all of the seasonings she needs. Alma has maD. a living in this way for many years, and it is for that that she wishes to be able to invest a little more in the business and so increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains, yuca, and limes.

loans.name: Estela Ariday

texts.es: Estela Ariday M. O. de 67 años de edad vive en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija de 22 años de edad, la cual se dedica a trabajar. Estela posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y gracias al cual cuenta con todo lo necesario para poder tener una vida digna junto a su hija, ya que entre las dos trabajan muy duro por poder salir adelante con todos los gastos del hogar solventados. Es por esta razón que Estela solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos alimenticios, como granos básicos, pan, galletas, huevo, mantequillas entre otros más los cuales son muy necesarios en los hogares y que por esto se venden más en el lugar. Esto le permitirá poder mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias, haciendo el negocio más rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Estela Ariday M. O. is 67 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the San Salvador region. She lives with her daughter, who is 22 years old and works. Estela has a store in which she sell basic necessities. The business is located in her home, and thanks to the business, she can count on everything necessary to have a dignified life with her daughter, since between the two of them, they work very hard to be able to get ahead, with all their household expenses paid.

It is for this reason that Estela is applying for a loan at Integral. With it, she will be able to buy a larger quantity of food products, such as basic grains, bread, crackers, eggs, and butter, among other items. These items are very necessary in homes and are the most sold items in this area. This will permit her to improve her profit margins, making the business more profitable for her.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic necessities to sell in her store

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian O. R. de 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo quien trabaja como empleado para la empresa Avícola Salvadoreña, y junto a su hijo de 9 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ana posee una tortillería en donde se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas, debido a que tiene muchos años de tener este negocio, ya es muy conocida en la zona, ya que es alguien muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza por realizar un excelente trabajo, lo cual le beneficia por el hecho de que las personas buscan su producto por estas razones. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, el cual es la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas, esto le permitirá atender a más clientes, de manera que pueda percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian O. R. is 35 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and her nine year old son who is in school. Her husband works for a company called “Avícola Salvadoreña” (Salvadoran Poultry Farm). Ana has a tortilla shop where she makes and sells her products. She has many years of experience in this business and is already well-known in the area. Ana is a very hard worker who strives to do an excellent job. As a result, people are always looking to buy her product.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn in bulk since it is the main ingredient used in making tortillas. This will allow her to serve more customers and help her to generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles C. C. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y su hija la cual al igual que su padre es empleada de una empresa privada y junto a ellos viven también tres nietos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, el cual es una zona muy buena para su negocio, ya que es la única tienda que hay en los alrededores, así también cuenta con la ventaja de que haya un mercado de donde las vendedoras llegan a su tienda a comprar productos de primera necesidad. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles C. C. is 49 years old. She lives in the township of Ilopango, which is located in the district of San Salvador, the capital of the country. She lives with her husband, who works, and her daughter, who, like her father, is an employee of a private business. Three grandchildren also live with them. They are all minors and are in school. Maria has a store that is located in her own house, which is in a very good location for her business, since it is the only store in the outskirts. She also has the advantage that there is a market, from which the vendors come to her store to buy basic products. Maria is applying for a loan so that she will have the money necessary to buy larger quantities of products, so that she can offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: María Fidelina

texts.es: María Fidelina R. C. de 40 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad. María posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación en donde vende todos los productos que las personas consumen en sus hogares. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad en el hogar, de manera que pueda contar con más clientela y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es muy necesario para ella, ya que desea poder brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia para poder vivir de una manera más adecuada con todo lo necesario para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
María Fidelina R. C. is 40 years old and resides in Ilopango, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a merchant, and their two dependent children. María has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. María’s business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús T. D. S. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como fontanero, y sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Con la ventaja D. habitar en una D. las ciudades con mayor comercio D. la ciudad D. San Salvador, Teresa posee una venta D. comida, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en donD. comercializa diferentes tipos D. sopas, las cuales son tradicionales D. El Salvador, y que por esta razón se venden mucho. Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por poder obtener ganancias extras para poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. los alimentos D. manera que pueda realizar mayor cantidad D. ellos.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús T. D. S. is 41 years old. She lives in the township of Soyapango, located in the Sal Salvador district. She lives with her husband, who works as a plumber, and their two minor children, who are in school. With the advantage of living in one of the cities with major traD. from the city of San Salvador, Teresa sells food from her home. She sells different types of soup, which are traditional in El Salvador, and for this reason she sells a lot. Teresa is a very hard-working woman who exerts herself every day to obtain extra earnings in order to have better economic stability. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan, which she will use to buy all the basic ingredients to prepare her foods in such a way that she can produce larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia M. D. C. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijas menores D. edad. Antonia posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo hace pupusas y frescos D. frutas. Su negocio esta ubicado frente a el Instituto San Luis, ubicado en la ciudad D. Soyapango, cuyos alumnos son sus clientes más frecuentas, así posee muchos clientes los cuales son habitantes del lugar. Antonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario como verduras, frutas, carne y platos desechables, todo lo que le sea útil para la elaboración y venta D. alimentos. Este negocio es muy importante para ella, ya que es el que le permite pagar muchos D. los gastos familiares, D. manera que pueda ayudarle a su esposo.
texts.en:
Antonia M. D. C. is 42 years old and resides in the town of Soyapango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who is devoted to his work, and their two young daughters. Antonia has a diner where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. At the same time, she makes pupusas and serves fresh fruit. Her business is located in front of the San Luis Institute in the city of Soyapango. The students are frequent customers, as well as the local residents.

Antonia is requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary supplies for her business such as vegetables, fruit, meat, and disposable plates. All of these items are useful in preparing and selling food. This business is very important because it allows her to pay most of the family expenses, which is a great help to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María Lilian R. D. P.  D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija, la cual trabaja como enfermera en la Unidad D. Salud D. Ilopango y junto a su pequeña nieta. María posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa D. habitación en donD. venD. todos los productos D. primera necesidad como alimenticios y para los quehaceres del hogar. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad, D. manera que pueda contar con más clientela y D. esta forma aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es muy necesario para ella, ya que desea poder brindarle una mejor vida a su nieto, dándole la ayuda necesaria a su hija para poder contar con una vida estable para ellos.
texts.en:
María Lilian R. D. P. is 55 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her daughter, who works as a nurse at the Ilopango Health Unit, and her young granddaughter. María has a store in her home where she sells basic necessities, food, and other products used for household chores.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds to buy a large quantity of food products and other basic necessities. This will help her to attract more customers and increase her sales. María’s business is very important because it enables her to proviD. a better life for her grandchild and assistance to her daughter so that they can all live a stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: Juana Isabel Q. D. P., resiD. en El Transito, ubicado en el departamento D. San Miguel, al oriente del país. Vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 9 y 6 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor se dedica a estudiar educación básica y el pequeño asiste al kinder. El esposo D. Juana resiD. en los Estados Unidos, donD. trabaja muy duro para poder mandarles remesas cada mes. Juana posee una tortillería la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación y donD. elabora tortillas casa mediodía y tarD., este producto es parte D. la dieta básica D. los salvadoreños por lo que se consume todos los días desD. una a tres veces al día, acompañando cada  tiempo D. comida. Esto es D. mucho beneficio para Juana ya que las personas consumen mucho el producto que ella elabora. Juana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor, esto le permitirá obtenerlo a precios más bajos lo cual será D. mucha ayuda para ella, ya que le permitirá percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel Q. D. P. resides in El Transito, which is located in the Department of San Miguel in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her two children, ages 9 and 6. The older child is in elementary school, while the younger one attends kindergarten. Juana’s husband lives in the United States. He works extremely hard and is able to send remittances each month.

Juana has a tortilla shop in her house where she prepares tortillas at noon and in the evening. This product is a staple of the Salvadoran diet and is consumed every day, up to three times a day, since it is usually accompanied with each meal. This is a great benefit to Juana since she already has customers who consume much of what she makes.

She is requesting a loan so that she will have the funds needed to purchase corn in bulk. This will allow her to buy at lower prices, which will be a great help since she will be able to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina P. D. L. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en la playa el Espino, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus cuatro hijos D. 17, 14, 11 y 8 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, su esposo resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, quien le brinda ayuda económica. María posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios, los cuales son muy necesarios en un lugar turístico como en el que ella vive, productos como agua embotellada y otros más. Marina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales pueda vender tanto con las personas que habitan en el lugar como turistas que visitan la playa. Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea salir adelante y D. esta manera brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina P. D. L. is 44 years old and resides in Playa el Espino, which is located in the Department of Usulután. There she lives with her four children (ages 17, 14, 11, and 8) who are in school. Her husband lives in the United States and provides her with financial assistance. Marina has a store where she sells food products that are necessities for being in a tourist spot, such as bottled water and other items.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of basic necessities to sell to the local residents as well as tourists who visit the beach. Marina is an enterprising woman who desires to move forward and proviD. her children with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

location.town: playa el Espino, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca M. D. D. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio y junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales estudian por las mañanas y en las tardes le ayudan a su madre con el negocio, residen en el departameto D. La Unión. Francisca posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal D. La Unión, lugar el cual posee una gran afluencia D. personas, las cuales llegan a diario a comprar los productos del lugar. Es por esta razón que Francisca desea poder contar con más productos para contar con la capacidad necesaria para atender mayor cantidad D. clientes. Esto es D. mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen como grupo familiar ya que todos trabajan en el, es por ello que Francisca desea aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca M. D. D. is 50 years old and lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband, who helps her in the business, and her 2 children who are underage. Her children study in the mornings and in the afternoons they help their mother with the business, they live in La Unión department. Francisca sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of La Unión, a place where she has a great influx of people who buy products on a daily basis. It is for this reason that Francisca wishes to have more products, so that she will be able to take care of her customers. This is of great help to her and her family since it is the only source of income for their family since they all work in the market, this is why Francisca wishes to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa S. D. U. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como pescador, y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y a ayudarle a María con el negocio. Ella posee una venta D. sandalias para hombres, mujeres y niños, su negocio esta ubicado en e centro D. Zacatecoluca, por lo que cuenta con una ubicación muy estratégica, ya que esta a la vista D. todas las personas que transitan por el lugar. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo  D. poder invertir en su inventario, ya que desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. sandalias, y así mismo comprar zapatos en diferentes tallas, colores y estilos, tanto formales como zapatos informales para hombres, niños y mujeres. Todo esto lo hace con el fin D. poder mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María Luisa S. D. U. is 27 years old and lives in Zacatecoluca, located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband who works as a fisherman, and their 3 children who are under age, they go to school and help their mother with the business. She sells sandals for men, women and children; her business is located in downtown Zacatecoluca, which is in a very strategic location since it is visited by all the people who visit the area. María needs a loan from Integral (Kiva’s field partner) to invest in her inventory since she wishes to be able to buy a greater quantity of sandals as well as shoes in different sizes, colors and styles and formal as well as casual shoes for men, children and women. She does all of this so that she will be able to improve her income so that she can have greater economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca P. D. V. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a sus 3 hijos D. 11, 5 y 4 años D. edad. Francisca posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, la cual posee una ubicación muy buena, ya que se encuentra en su propia casa D. habitación donD. esta es la única tienda del lugar, así mismo esto le permite poder estar al tanto D. sus hijos y poder cuidarlos y ayudarles con las tareas. Francisca es madre soltera quien trabaja para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus pequeños hijos quienes dependen por completo D. ella. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad, lo cual le permita percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca P. D. V. is 33 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 3 children of 11, 5, and 4 years of age. Francisca has a store for basic household goods which is in a very good location since it is in her own home and it is the only store in the area. Because her store is in her home, she can take care of her children and help them with their homework. Francisca is a single mother who works hard to give her children all the essentials since they completely depend on her. She needs the loan so that she can have the necessary amount of money to invest in her business, by buying a greater quantity of food products and basic household goods, which will allow her to have greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic household goods.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. de 41 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. María posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se dedica a elaborarlas, este negocio le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, ya que es María la única persona que trabaja,  por esta razón solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor, de manera que lo obtenga a menor precios, así mismo comprar tambos de gas, para tener una pequeña provisión de este, ya que en ciertas ocasiones el gas propano escasea y sube de precio, lo que significa muchas perdidas para ella. María desea poder mejorar sus ventas, atendiendo mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera contar con la estabilidad económica tan deseada por ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
María Isabel R. is 41 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 18 year old son who is going to school. María sells and makes tortillas. This business allows her to have everything necessary for her home, since María is the only person that works. She is seeking a loan through Integral (Kiva’s field partner) so that she can have the necessary amount of money to buy corn wholesale to have a lower price in the raw product, as well to buy additional tanks of propane gas to have a small supply of it since it sometimes becomes scarce and the price rises which means a great loss in profits. María wishes to improve her sales by serving a greater quantity of customers so that she can have greater economic stability so wished by her and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas.

loans.name: John

texts.en: Mr. John K. is 43 years old. He has a retail shop that he has been operating for over five years. He is using the loan to expand his retail business by purchasing items such as sugar, salt, soap, flour, rice and so forth for sale. He expects to own a large wholesale shop and create new opportunities.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, soap, flour, rice and so forth

loans.name: Magido Abudu

texts.en: Mr. Magido Abudu K. is 34 years old and owns a retail shop. He has been operating the business for over seven years. He is using the loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, sweets, biscuits, and so forth to expand his business. He is a married man and a father of one child. His dream is to work very hard for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, sweets, biscuits, and so forth\

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en: Mr. K. Tonny is 40 years old. He is married with three children and lives in Lungujja-Kosovo as a permanent resident. He has a retail shop and he has been operating it for over two years. He is using the loan to purchase retail stuff like cups, saucepans, spoons, forks, plates, basins, and so forth. He expects to own a large super market supplying utensils and even create opportunities for others.

loans.use: To purchase cups, saucepans, spoons, forks, plates, basins, and so forth,

loans.name: Abesiga Mukama Group

texts.en:
N. Agnes is 40, single, and the mother to six school-going children. Her single status has not won her any laurels in her home area of Bwetyaba, Mukono district. Being a single and poor woman, it was expected she would beat a retreat but a resilient and unfazed Agnes rose from the proverbial ashes to put in place her own small but dependable source of income.

In 2007, having pocketed her pride, she began her own firewood and fresh food business. Her new business was below par operationally at its start and she had little capital to make her business gain substantial ground. With time she was able to make some headway but, up to now, financial problems evidently still plague her.

Agnes reveals she makes, in a week, a paltry 30,000 shillings. This is considerably low for a woman with huge responsibilities. She envisages a future where she can diversify her small firewood-selling and fresh fruit business even further to where she will be able to build a family house.

With this loan, Agnes wants to buy more firewood so that she will be able to supply her increasing client base. She also wants to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood and more fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new painting tools and additional paints supplies

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en: Henrik A. was born in 1955. He is married and lives with his family in Kirants village, Ijevan area. Henrik has three children: two daughters and a son. His elder daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. The two other children are school age. For 33 years, Henrik has worked in the electric power station as an electrical technician. At the same time, he has been engaged in farming. On his farm he has cows, pigs and chickens. He also is engaged in land cultivation. Henrik's wife helps him a lot in farming. With the income from farming, Henrik solved his family needs, organized his daughter's wedding and enlarged his farm. Henrik asks for an 850,000-AMD loan to buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Wadih

texts.en:
Wadih is a 23-year-old young man. Since 2008, he has had a computer business to help provide various types of accounting services for members and companies of his community. This talented young man has already taken a first Kiva loan and he has repaid his loan successfully. This will be mentioned by the MFI while uploading the payments. He's pleased with the decision to take a loan from Ameen and very thankful for the progress of his work. 

That’s the reason why he is asking for a new loan of $1,200 to purchase two computers to satisfy the demands of the market. He's planning to take more accounting work in the next months.

loans.use: To purchase two computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm oil

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca sells cooking oil like palm and groundnut oil. She buys in bulk and sells at retail. She gets goods across Lagos and has been in this business since 2000. Franca is 39 years old, married to a customs officer and they have five children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. With part of her profit and what her husband brings in, they are able to clothe, feed and take care of their children's school fees. Franca is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu,43 years old, is a mother of two children. She sells food items and other soup items. Before now she hawked cooked food from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. After joining LAPO, she has been able to own a shop.
Saratu opens her shop everyday of the week, 8am to 6pm except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding her children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Saratu is asking for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase food, in bulk, at a reduced rate. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Hasab

texts.en:
Hasab is a 37-year-old widow woman raising 3 children. She has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years. She cultivates all types of vegetables and fruits, according to the season. Two of her children try to help her with the family's income. With the help of several loans from Ameen, she has been able to develop her business level. 

Today, Hasab is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds. She says that with the help of the loan she will be able to cultivate her land with new summer vegetables and fruits to increase her sales and, therefore, her income.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells food items, such as garri, rice and yam flour. She buys in large quantities and sells to retailers. She is hard working and she has to leave home as early as 5am to be able get goods to buy from the market to stock her shop. She has been in business for six years. With this business, she supports her husband, a school teacher, in order to provide for his family's needs. 
She wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase food items in bulk at a discount to sell.

Sarah is 56 years old, married, and has six children and they are doing fine in Lagos, Nigeria. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en:
Mireille is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of 2 dependent children. After 8 years of experience and a good career, she opened a beauty salon in 2006 and she started receiving her village ladies. During these 3 years, she has been able to make a good number of clients and so, a good business reputation. 

Today, Mireille is requesting to borrow $1,200 to expand her business by adding new services and by purchasing more equipment to increase her business productivity and income as a result of this loan. She will also be able to attract new clients from other areas.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding new services and by purchasing more equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Obioha

texts.en:
Virgina is 47years old, married and has six children under her care. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She sells plantain, yams and potatoes and has been in this business for over nine years. She makes sure customers demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.
Virgina is requesting for a loan of NGN50,000  to purchase yams and potatoes in bulk at a discount for sale. She says thank you and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase yam and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe is trader. She sells snacks (gala) and has been in this business since 1997, but started as a retailer. Now she could sell at wholesale and retail prices. She requests for a loan of NGN150,000 to purchase more cartons of snacks (Gala) to sell, which will in turn lead to a price reduction and increase her profit.
 
Dupe is 50 years old, married and has five children. With the increase in profit as a result of this loan, her family will be better cared for. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of snacks (Gala) to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 47-year-old married man and father of 4 children whom 3 are still school-age. He has been working for the past 30 years as a furniture painter; he owns a small factory where he processes his work. His oldest daughter tried to help her father by contributing her income from her part-time job at a mini-market in her town. His wife owns a small food market also and she cooperates with him in the household. Today, Joseph is requesting to borrow $500 to purchase additional paints and tools to fulfill his business objectives for the next months to better market his services and increase the liquidity of his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional paints and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ayinke

texts.en:
Ayinke sells paint and other building materials. She has been in this trade for 10 years now. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more paint to sell. This, she said, will reduce the cost price and transportation to market and increase the profit, which will better help her in caring for her family.

Ayinke is 36 years old and married to Mr. L. who is a transporter. They have four children and live with the family in Lagos state, Nigeria. Ayinke says thank you to all lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more paint to sell.

loans.name: Kiwumulo Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
K. Rose is a lively 34-year-old widowed mother with two school-going children. Her four-year-old boutique business in Seeta, MuKono, has been her financial recourse as she grapples with the solitary responsibility of taking care of her children.

The lack of capital to expand her business has been one of Rose’s undoings over the years. With monthly profit returns of 80,000 shillings, she has not been able to consolidate her business venture. As such, she wants a loan to buy new equipment for her boutique and to move into bigger premises.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her boutique and to move into bigger premises

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: F. sells and rents VCDs. She has been in business for the past five years and with this trade, she assists her husband with the children's upbringing. F. has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and is a faithful client. She goes to market once every two weeks to get goods in a large quantity at a discount. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to enable her to purchase more VCDs in bulk, which will enable her to meet her customers' demands. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. F. is 33 years old and married to Mr. Adamu who is an event manager. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD to sell

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik V. lives in Vanadzor city with her family. Her daughter and husband help Goharik in her business, which consists of souvenirs and glassware trading. Goharik has been engaged in that business for 20 years. She uses the income for her family. Goharik purchases an assortment of products from Yerevan once a week. Goharik needs a 1,000,000-AMD loan to buy a new assortment for her shop: glass, dishes, statuettes, etc.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of products for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce mushrooms

loans.name: Valdemiro Luis

texts.pt:
Valdimiro Luís G. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 32 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 05 e 02 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas ainda tenciona continuar. Vive na casa propria com sua família e de vez enquanto sustenta seus irmaõs enviando dinheiro e alguns bens de consumo.
Saiu de Maputo para Boane quando casou e tem um negócio próprio há mais de 8 anos possui um empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de trabalho de mobilização feita pelos oficiais da Hluvuku. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (cimento e areia) para o fabrico de blocos e vender no seu estaleiro.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Valdimiro Luís was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, South of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children who are 5 and 2 years old. They do not yet go to school. He went to school until the 12th but didn't finish it do to the lack of financial resources, although he intends to. He lives with his family in his own house and from time to time supports his siblings by sending them money and a few goods. He left Maputo to go to Boane when he got married. He has had his own business for more than 8 years and has one employee. He earns around 10.000.00mt per month which goes to household expenses and a savings account. He has never requested loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through the enrollment efforts of its officers. This loan is his first in the amount of 10.000.00mt. He intends to buy cement and sand to manufacture building blocks and sell them in his stand. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to invest in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and sand to manufacture building blocks and sell them in his stand

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is a hair stylist who makes lovely western and Nigerian hairstyles for her customers. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business for 15 years. She is married with four children and she is 42 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy as a mother. She lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. Esther is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Filipe Bernardo

texts.pt:
Filipe Bernardo Marrengula nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 32 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 13 e 02 anos de idade, os mais velhos vai a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou porque tem problemas de visão. Vive na casa cedida pela instituição onde trabalha com a sua família e de vez enquanto sustenta seus pais enviando alguns bens de consumo.
Saiu da matola para Boane quando começou a constituir a sua família. Ė Funcionário do Ministério da Educação a título de contrato há 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, tem um salário mensal de 7.400.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de mobilizações. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 30.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Filipe Bernardo was born in town of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children who are 13 and 2 years old. The oldest is in school. He finished 10th grade but didn't continue due to problems in his sight. He lives with his family in a house loaned by the institution that employs him. Occasionally, he helps his parents by sending them a few goods. He left Matola to go to Boane when he started his family. He has been working for the Ministry of Education as a contractor for two years. He does not have any employees. His monthly salary is 7.400.00mt, which goes to household expenses. He also manages to put some money into a savings account. He has never requested loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through campaigns. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt is his fourth. He intends to buy building materials (cement, logs, iron, zinc screens and others) in order to continue to build his home. The previous loans were for 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 30.000.00mt and were all applied towards the same activity. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, logs, iron, zinc screens and others)

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a hard working woman who is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells groceries like milk, sugar, and toothpaste and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with four children and she is 39 years old. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Esperanca Jose

texts.pt:
Esperança José N. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 2 filhos de 29 e 21 anos de idade, já não estudam. Fez somente 3ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, porque perdeu o pai muito jovem. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com a mãe depois de perder o pai. Tem um negócio próprio desde a sua juventude, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa, porque não possui conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (fardos de roupa usada para crianças) para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na melhoria da sua casa.
texts.en:
Esperança José was born in the District of Chibuto, in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, separated and mother of two children who are 29 and 21 years old. They are no longer in school. She only completed 3rd grade and didn't finish school due to the lack of financial resources since her father died when she was very young. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She left Gaza to go to Maputo with her mother after she lost her father. She has had her own business since her youth and does not have any employees. She has an income of around 6.000.00mt, which she spends with household expenses and saves some on her own since she does not have a bank account. She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her sister. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt. She intends to purchase used children's clothing in bulk to increase her inventory. She is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans for improvements in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used children's clothing in bulk

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah A. is married and is 35 years old. He is blessed with three children and they are excelling in school and this gives him joy as a father. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Elijah sells medicines at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for twelve years and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers. He is requesting for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
O. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children.

O. sells rechargeable phone cards wholesale to her customers. She has been in this business for some years now and has been doing well. She is focused on making sure she meets the demands of her customers which she said will also lead to an increase in profit-making.

O. is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and earn more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back at the due date and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards in bulk

loans.name: Makiese Plus Group

texts.en:
Pitshou, single and aged 33, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Makiese Plus”, which is composed of thirty-three members. They are united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the micro-finance institute HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Pitshou started his business in 2005 with $25 as initial capital. He manages his business in the northeastern part of Kinshasa. He has already received four different loans from HOPE DRC and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to purchase two 10 kilogram cartons of fish, one 10 kilogram cartons of sardines and two 15 kilogram cartons of soap for resale with the aim of increasing his profits.

Each week, Pitshou’s business brings in a profit of $102. His ambition is to open a store in his area. He is determined to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joyeux Lutins Plus Group

texts.en:
Bénita M., aged 46, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Joyeux Lutins Plus”. It is composed of twenty-nine members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bénita has been a part of the micro-enterprise world for years. She sells salted and smoked fish, palm oil and doughnuts. Her business is located to the east of Kinshasa.

Bénita has already received two loans from the micro-finance institute HOPE DRC and has repaid them correctly. The loan she’ll obtain this time will be used to buy more goods to sell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $102 per week.

Bénita is divorced and the mother of four children whose ages range between 9 and 20. All four of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aremu

texts.en:
Aremu has four children and he is 40 years and married. His children attend school and this gives him joy as a father. He is a hard working man and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Aremu sells sarongs and poultry feeds at retail prices. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his immediate family. He has been in this business for eight years.

Aremu is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more poultry feeds and sarongs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and poultry feeds to sell

loans.name: Niyazova Zuhrahon`s Group

texts.ru:
Зухрахон, 41 год. Она замужем и воспитывает 2 сыновей. Оба учатся в школе. Клиент занимается полеводством, выращивает картофель. Этим бизнесом она занимается 12 лет, с момента разделения земельных наделов. Ее супруг находится на заработках в России. кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений. 

Малохат, 41. Ее супруг работает частным родителем в Араване. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и дочь. Двое старших детей работают, младшие учатся в школе. Она также занимается выращиванием картофеля. Кредит нужен для закупа удобрений, т.к. в настоящее время спрос на них увеличивается и растет цена продукции. 

Дилафзахон замужем. У нее 3 детей. Супруг является членом крестьянского хозяйства. На своем земельном наделе они выращивают картофель и пшеницу. Она также собирается закупить удобрения на полученный кредит. 

Последним членом группы является Муроджон. Он женат и отец 2 детей. дочь работает в столовой, а сын учится в школе. Как и предыдущие участники, он тоже занимается земледелием. Цель кредита также аналогична предыдущим клиентам.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zuhrahon, 41 years old. She is married and raising two sons. Both sons go to school. This client does farming work, growing potatoes. She has been doing this for 12 years, from the time when land plots had been divided. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. The loan is being requested to purchase mineral fertilizers. Malohat, 41 years old. Her husband works as a private chauffeur in Aravan. She has four children: three sons and a daughter. The two older children work, the younger ones go to school. She also grows potatoes. The loan is needed to purchase fertilizers, because they are now in greater demand and their prices are growing. Dilafzahon is married. She has three children. Her husband is a member of a farmer’s union. They grow potatoes and wheat on their land plot. She is also planning to use her loan to buy fertilizers. Finally, the last member of this group, Murodjon. He is married and the father of two children. His daughter works in a cafeteria, and his son goes to school. As the other group members, he also does farming. The purpose of his loan is also the same as above.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Humilité Plus Group

texts.en:
Mbala K. is the leader of the Community Bank named “Humilité Plus” which is composed of twenty-six members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mbala has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1994. He operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area.

Mbala would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $360 per month. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals.

Mbala is a trustworthy client of the micro-finance institute HOPE DRC, having twice obtained and correctly repaid a loan. He will increase his stock of merchandise with this next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit.

At 51 years old, Mbala is married and the father of five children, whose ages range between 11 and 31 years. Four of them attend college.

loans.use: To increase his store’s stock

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
35-year-old Saidat is married with two children and they live in Lagos. She is a businesswoman who she sells groceries like tomato paste, milk, tea and more to make a living. She operates the trade with the support of her husband. She started the business thirteen years ago and works hard to meet her customers’ demands.

Saidat is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase groceries in bulk to sell as this will enable her get a better discount, attract more customers and earn more profit on her sales. She promise to pay back promptly and says thank you.

Saidat is a member of LAPO micro-finance and has been borrowing for the past four years. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries in bulk

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a hardworking woman and she is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She is married with five children and is happy because she is also a grandmother. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells groceries like milk, sugar and toothpaste and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

Esther is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yomi

texts.en:
Yomi is well-known as a businessman in his community. He keeps poultry and rears birds to sell. He has been in this business for four years. He hopes to attract more customers to purchase more birds. His greatest challenge is funds and he hopes to overcome this challenge.

Yomi is married with a child and he is 39 years old. His wife also works to support their home.

Yomi is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more poultry feeds to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feeds

loans.name: Génèse Plus Group

texts.en:
Didier K. is the president of the Community Bank called “Génèse Plus”. The group is composed of twenty-six members who are united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through micro-finance institute HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Didier runs a telephone booth to the west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000 with beginning capital of $50. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Didier is now well-known and liked in this new area.

Didier is a trustworthy client who has received loans five times from HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $90 profit each week.

Didier intends, with this next loan, to purchase more prepaid cards to meet his customers’ demands and to generate additional profits.

Didier is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children aged between 4 and 19 of whom six go to school. His ambition is to open a pharmacy in his area.

loans.use: To buy more prepaid cellphone cards

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dynamique Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne N. K., a 54-year-old married mother of ten children, five of whom attend school, is the leader of a Community bank named “Dynamique Plus”, comprised of 25 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

In a market located in the south-west part of Kinshasa, Anne sells shikwanges, (a kind of bread made of manioc flour) which are Kinshasa’s main food. In business since 1982, Anne has received and fully repaid seven loans from HOPE DRC for business expansion. With the next loan, she will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. One of Anne’s strategies to keep her clients is to inform them in advance of any change that might occur in the business. Her ambition is to become a key shikwanges provider in her area.

loans.use: To purchase 2 50kg/sacks of manioc to increase her inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is a hardworking woman and she is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She is happy because her children are excelling in school.

Iyabo sells foodstuffs like yam, yam flour and cooking oil and she has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Iyabo is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ana Jaime

texts.pt:
Ana Jaime M. nasceu na cidade da M., Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 36 anos de idade casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 14, 12, 10 e 7 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família.
Nunca sai de cidade onde nasceu. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 10 anos não tem nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e, com ajuda da pensão do marido, poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas vizinhas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimentos, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
Tem como sonho fazer um empréstimo para a aquisição de uma viatura, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros.
texts.en:
Ana Jaime M. was born in the city of M., Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 36 years old, is married, and is the mother of four children, ages 14, 12, 10 and 7. All of them go to school. Ana only finished sixth grade; she did not continue because of a lack of money. She lives in her own house with her family. Ana never left her hometown. She has had her own business for more than ten years. She has no employees and earns an income of about 9,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband's pension, she also saves some money in her bank account. She has never taken out loans with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her neighbors, who are also customers of this institution. This is her fourth loan.
